runners.name: Dal Mallart
runners.comment: Won three 1m2f turf handicaps last summer but not so good later in year; off six months
runners.spotlight: Won three 1m2f turf handicaps last summer but the handicapper had caught up by the end of the season; 0-4 on AW, although the first three were her qualifying runs; first outing for six months.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Dal Mallart is progressive, but got a bit lost at Nottingham the other day - it was her first time on grass. I thought she'd come forward and David thought she learned plenty. She's got a good staying pedigree and she'll be over a mile and a half before long - Alan King, trainer.

runners.name: Wynter Wildes
runners.comment: Consistent in handicap last year; claims if ready to roll on return; yard won this in 2022
runners.spotlight: Consistent in handicaps last year, including on AW; feasibly handicapped if ready to roll on her seasonal return for a stable which won this race last year.

stable_tour.quote: She won a mile maiden at Southwell in March and added to that on Friday at Hamilton when she came home six and a half lengths clear in a 1m1f handicap on soft ground. That was off a mark of 65, but I suspect the handicapper will take a dim view of a very impressive success. I have no doubt she will stay further than that nine furlongs and I expect there are a few more wins to come from this filly. 18-05-22

runners.name: New Heights
runners.comment: Won three times in 2022 but needed her reappearance run last year
runners.spotlight: Successful three times (8.5f/1m1f) during a consistent 2022 campaign on turf; bit below form over C&D on her final start but she did win on Polytrack at the start of her career; been off for 189 days and needed her first run back last season.

quotes.race: Always Bet Responsibly At BetVictor Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I made a mistake with New Heights, thinking she'd get further and she ran well at Bath dropped back to a mile and a quarter last time. This track suited her well, probably a bit better than Bath. The handicapper will screw things up and she is what she is - she hasn't got a stone in hand. We'll run her where there's a race - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Flower Of Thunder
runners.comment: Four wins last year (including C&D); first outing for 187 days
runners.spotlight: Back in the groove with two 1m2f wins at Yarmouth under Isobel Francis at the end of last summer; below-form over C&D on her final start but she did score over C&D last spring; on a career-high mark.

quotes.race: Cazoo Search Drive Smile Handicap
quotes.quote: We were going to make the running but decided to take a lead but Flower Of Thunder has done that easily. She's a nice filly and hopefully she can do it gain - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

runners.name: Mountain Queen
runners.comment: AW maiden win in November and went close in 1m Southwell handicap on return; respected
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a Wolverhampton maiden in November and went down by only a neck in 1m Southwell handicap four months later; back up in trip; ought to remain very competitive off 1lb higher.

runners.name: Angels Landing
runners.comment: Struggled over hurdles this winter but may fare better back on Flat; has had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat-racer; struggled over hurdles this winter but went close off this mark on turf last September and won on AW earlier in her career so she's dangerous to dismiss back on the level after wind surgery.

runners.name: My Little Queens
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Third on AW on final 2022 start; has won when fresh before; respected
runners.spotlight: 4-12 on turf and showed she's fully effective on AW when third over 1m2f at Newcastle when last seen in November; won on last year's reappearance; one to consider.

runners.name: Miss Harmony
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud & Mrs C R Philipson
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Xlviii And Partner

prev_owners.owner: C Philipps T Redman & T Trotter

runners.comment: Only nudged up 1lb for latest small-field Lingfield win so should remain competitive
runners.spotlight: Gained reward for some consistent efforts this winter (including C&D) when winning a four-runner Lingfield handicap 13 days ago; effectively 2lb higher here (1lb out of handicap); thereabouts.

runners.name: Smith
runners.comment: Regular winner in small fields over 2m on Polytrack; career-high mark but can't discount
runners.spotlight: Four 2m wins at Lingfield since the start of 2022, most recent when last seen 55 days ago; those wins came in small fields so he's clearly tactically versatile; career-high mark but folly to rule out.

runners.name: Cedar Cage
runners.comment: Recent form reads well but settling him will be key back up to 2m
runners.spotlight: Recent form, including 1m6f win under George Eddery, reads well but there must be a doubt about him settling fully returned to a longer trip.

runners.name: Rock Chant
runners.comment: Back to form in this headgear combination and he's the one to beat if taking to Chelmsford
runners.spotlight: Back to form in this headgear combination, achieving form figures of 2113 at four different AW tracks; runs at Chelmsford for the first time and he's the one to beat if taking to it.

runners.name: Infiniti
runners.owner: Total Asbestos Solutions Ltd & A Frost

prev_owners.owner: Total Asbestos Solutions Ltd & Mrs A Frost
Mrs Susan Ashford And Mike Brindley

runners.comment: 10yo won six from 11 last year but hurdles return was disappointing
runners.spotlight: No sign age is catching up with her, winning six times from 11 Flat/hurdle starts last year; hurdles return was disappointing and she may be best watched.

quotes.race: Gumley Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Infiniti did not have much weight and she is obviously a nice spare ride. She had been placed a number of times in the past so deserved to get her head in front - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: What Will Be
runners.comment: 2-2 here, his second 1m6f win came 12 days ago; 2m surely okay but this is tougher
runners.spotlight: 2-2 here, his second 1m6f win came 12 days ago; should have no trouble seeing out 2m but tackling a 0-70 demands more; up 3lb.

runners.name: Huscari
runners.comment: Did best in real blanket finish last time; more is needed but has had just six starts
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame here in first 2m handicap before doing best in real blanket finish (first seven covered by just over a length and a half) at Lingfield (also 2m); more is needed but has had just six starts; up 2lb.

runners.name: Spirited Guest
runners.comment: There are positives but he ended 2022 on a real low and widest stall isn't ideal
runners.spotlight: Has gone well fresh, is 2-5 here and is back below last winning mark; ended 2022 on a real low, though, and widest stall isn't ideal.

runners.name: Buckshaw Village
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Two good runs from two over C&D and looks poised to go very well
runners.spotlight: Just 1-18 but C&D fourth in first-time cheekpieces (retained) six weeks ago signalled he may soon double tally; winner is 2-2 since and the seventh scored next time; track and trip third from stall 13 to sign off 2022 also reads well; big player.

runners.name: Wiseacre
runners.comment: Minor claims if better for return second at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Back from 279 days off when unable to fend off just a thriving rival at Wolverhampton 17 days ago (7f; first-time cheekpieces retained here); minor claims if better for that run.

runners.name: Flying Secret
runners.comment: 0-9 but some of his form reads well and moving back up to 7f could see him competitive
runners.spotlight: 0-9 but some of his form reads well, most recently a second to nice type at Kempton in November; no show next time but not impossible moving back up to 7f could see him competitive.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely colt from a great family. I cannot believe we got him for that price (75,000gns). He is going well but will not be super early. I would think he will be ready by the end of May, early June. 06-04-21

runners.name: Fiftyshadesofred

prev_owners.owner: H H Shaikh Nasser Al Khalifa & F Nass
H H Shaikh Nasser Al Khalifa & Partner

runners.comment: Not obvious at first glance but delving deeper makes him of interest
runners.spotlight: Winning stable debut off 8lb higher just over a year ago and best run since when making the frame in C&D 0-80 three runs ago; sat too close to the pace when not living up to market expectations on his return and can do better.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Four wins since last October and same mark as when collared on line nine days ago
runners.spotlight: Four wins since last October (including by 4l over C&D) and can race off the same mark as when collared on the line at Southwell nine days ago.

runners.name: Vape
runners.comment: Course win over Epic Express two ago; stays this far but may be vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Beat Epic Express by a neck two runs ago (6f) before unable to get loose on the front end (5f; both here); stays this far but may be vulnerable in this field.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap
quotes.quote: I was concerned about the ground for Vape as I wanted it quicker. Perhaps we'll have a go on the all-weather now unless we can find decent ground on turf. He tries his best and is a pleasure to train. I know he played up at Chepstow last time and was withdrawn, but I don't think it was truly his fault - John Flint, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I fancied Vape. I think we had some bad luck at Chelmsford last time. I didn't realise how important it was for the blinds to stay on until the last minute. We took them off early and he chanced the stalls and we got left. The winner scooted in that day, but I felt we'd have been in the frame, and coming back to six furlongs on ground softer than good was ideal. He's nice. He's big, but can go on good to firm, so hopefully we can get one or two more wins out of him - John Flint, trainer.

runners.name: Epic Express
runners.comment: Good run either side of being caught wide; might be vulnerable in this 0-75
runners.spotlight: Clear-best RPR when just unable to reel in Vape over 6f here in October and bounced back from lesser run (caught wide) off a break latest; hood retained; might be vulnerable in this 0-75.

6:00.race_name: Ladies Day Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Rhythm N Hooves
runners.comment: Head defeat then scored with bit up his sleeve; major claims despite 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: 4l in front of Asian Queen when going down by a head on debut at Wolverhampton before winning with a bit up his sleeve at Newcastle (also 5f, Beau Roc 5l back in third); major claims despite 7lb penalty.

runners.name: Bangles Joe
runners.comment: Fair debut nine days ago but may need another furlong or two to have a chance of winning
runners.spotlight: Second favourite but managed just sixth (beaten just under 5l) on debut at Thirsk nine days ago (5f, soft); may need another furlong or two to have a chance of winning.

runners.name: Rogue De Vega
runners.comment: Price dropped from 150,000gns to 40,000euros at breeze-up; brother to Mondammej
runners.spotlight: Price dropped from 150,000gns as a yearling to 40,000euros at breeze-up; fourth foal; brother to enigmatic Listed-placed 5f-6f winner Mondammej (including AW; RPR 108), half-brother to 5f-7f winner Soldierpoy; dam 5f winner (68); sole newcomer is worth a market check despite widest draw; already gelded.

runners.name: Carry On Aitch
runners.owner: Howard J Cooke & P J Mcbride
runners.comment: Peak RPR of 60 in six starts last year, tried at up to 7f; much more surely needed
runners.spotlight: Peak RPR of 60 in six starts last year, tried at up to 7f; surely needs to raise her game to win.

runners.name: Rhythmic Acclaim
runners.comment: Likely better than we've seen and could put it up to Rhythm N Hooves if not outpaced
runners.spotlight: Perhaps thought capable of better, given she's started 8-1 or shorter each time, and caught the eye a couple of times; could put it up to Rhythm N Hooves if not outpaced over this new trip.

runners.name: Beau Roc
runners.breeder: Pee Gee & W J Bloodtock & G R Tomlinson
runners.comment: Runner-up all three starts last year but 5l-third to Rhythm N Hooves on return
runners.spotlight: Runner-up all three starts last year but, back from 261 days off, she was a 5l-third to Rhythm N Hooves at Newcastle 13 days ago; second or third may be best hope despite plum draw.

runners.name: They Dont Know
runners.comment: Found just the odds-on favourite too good over C&D last week (pair 5l clear); 2lb well in
runners.spotlight: 0-20 but not with Tony Carroll for long and found just the odds-on favourite too good over C&D last week (pair 5l clear); major claims off same mark, he's 2lb well in.

runners.name: Early Morning Dew

prev_owners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And R J Marley

runners.comment: Three good runs from three for the Bests; could probably do with a good pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Like They Don't Know, is 0-20; three good runs from three for the Bests and shouldn't be long in winning; could probably do with a good pace to aim at; visor goes on.

runners.name: Kenilworth King
runners.comment: 1-1 under Benoit De La Sayette but likely needs to return from break in top form
runners.spotlight: Breakthrough win came only time Benoit De La Sayette rode him (9.4f Tapeta, last October); miss, hit and miss since and likely needs to return from break in top form to score again; cheekpieces applied.

runners.name: Kentucky Kingdom
runners.comment: Will need to settle better than of late but is handicapped to win and loves this C&D
runners.spotlight: Will need to settle better than of late under 7lb claimer but is handicapped to win and is a triple C&D scorer; certainly not ruled out.

runners.name: Dutch Admiral
runners.comment: Beat a total of one home in five starts since back from 444 days off in January
runners.spotlight: Beat a total of one home in five starts since back from 444 days off in January (100-1 or bigger each time); can't consider; two pieces of headgear return.

quotes.race: Bet 10 Get 20 With MansionBet Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dutch Admiral jumped well today. The last two times we've taken our time a little bit with him and I think he's just sulked in behind horses, so we tried something different today and it's worked. If he's going to get to any half-decent level he's going to have to improve again but time will tell - Brendan Powell, rider.

runners.name: Endofastorm
runners.comment: 125-1 Newcastle win looks an anomaly and needs to step forward from low-key stable debut
runners.spotlight: 125-1 Newcastle win in January (1m) looks an anomaly and needs to step forward from low-key stable debut last month; moves up to 1m2f.

runners.name: Claddaghduff
runners.comment: Still early days but hasn't looked entirely straightforward and best trip not obvious
runners.spotlight: Is lightly raced for a 5yo but hasn't looked entirely straightforward and pinpointing his best trip is proving difficult; rather watch.

runners.name: Mcqueen
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.comment: Often run well in defeat of late; returning to shorter could do the trick (can pull)
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back 1m wins 2021 into 2022 (first here) but expensive to follow, while often running well in defeat, since; can take a keen hold so returning to shorter could do the trick.

runners.name: Global Tycoon
runners.comment: May come on for return seventh and cheekpieces could aid
runners.spotlight: Winning handicap debut at Kempton last June (7f); poor next time but return from 274 days off last month wasn't bad (both 1m); cheekpieces go on for return to winning trip.

runners.name: Night Traveller
runners.comment: Bagged weak race here in January (1m); well held since and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Hollie Doyle helped her bag a weak race here in January (1m); well held since and others are preferred.

runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.comment: No show in three runs for Gary Moore but yard is banging in the winners now
runners.spotlight: 6f novice win for Gay Kelleway in 2021 came here; no show in three runs for Gary Moore but yard is banging in the winners now and this contest lacks depth.

runners.name: Love Destiny

prev_owners.owner: S Herrington, P Forster & Team Given 5

runners.comment: Yet to really fire for Michael Herrington and is due a 2lb drop
runners.spotlight: Last C&D try saw him win off 21lb higher for Mark Johnston (2021); yet to really fire for Michael Herrington and is due a 2lb drop.

runners.name: Thomas Equinas
runners.comment: First and second in classified company last month; this handicap looks winnable
runners.spotlight: Breakthrough win came in C&D classified under Robert Havlin (well backed) and conceded first run when runner-up in similar contest at Southwell four weeks ago; of obvious interest in this winnable handicap.

runners.name: Secret Tryst
runners.comment: Can only watch having left William Knight for 1,000gns in February
runners.spotlight: No sign of her learning to settle and is yet to make the frame; can only watch having left William Knight for 1,000gns in February.

runners.name: Tara
runners.comment: Bits of form but is hard to fancy on what we've seen in 2023
runners.spotlight: Kempton second and Windsor fourth (both 1m) last autumn offer hope but she's hard to fancy on what we've seen in 2023; returns to shorter.

runners.name: Warrior Square
runners.comment: Andrea Atzeni is an eyecatching booking for this lowly-rated runner; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Down the field in trio of 2021 novices over 6f; gelded and absent 564 days; showed a bit when 8-1 for handicap debut at Lingfield last month (7f) but he was well positioned and they finished in a heap; could strip fitter here and Andrea Atzeni is an eyecatching booking in this 0-55 handicap; non-runner.

runners.name: My Beauty
runners.comment: Beat a total of eight home in seven starts and she's again hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Beat a total of eight home in seven starts and she's again hard to fancy.

runners.name: Smooth Ryder
runners.comment: Expensive to follow of late but should stay this far and be hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Runner-up as favourite last three starts (9.4f/1m2f); winner of last week's contest (here) blew out the following day but front pair were over 8l clear and he's 3lb well in for this; should stay this far and be hard to beat.

runners.name: Sexy Rexy
runners.comment: Promises to be suited by this extra yardage and is the danger to Smooth Ryder
runners.spotlight: Best form when finding just Margaret Beaufort (non-runner) half-a-length too strong at Wolverhampton last month (1m4f); promises to be suited by this extra yardage.

runners.name: Vitani
runners.comment: Struggled so far; allotted opening mark of 39 but has to race off 46
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival first two starts and fared little better 83 days ago (1m/1m2f); allotted opening mark of 39 but has to race off 46.

runners.name: Steven Seagull
runners.comment: Tailed off all three starts last year (1m/1m2f) and gelded for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off all three starts last year (1m/1m2f) and gelded for handicap debut.

runners.name: Ostilio
runners.comment: Tumbling down the weights but no real sign of capitalising and form here doesn't stack up
runners.spotlight: Tumbling down the weights but no real sign of capitalising and form here doesn't stack up.

quotes.race: Racing TV EBF Stallions Guisborough Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Ostilio is back in great form. Even cantering down he seemed to relish the ground. Simon and Ed said keep it simple. It was the plan to grab the rail, my agent Steve Croft came up with it - we were drawn that side anyway and he tends to lug right a little bit so the rail helped. He's a good horse on his day and relished the conditions - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

quotes.race: P J Towey Construction Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Ostilio seems to be improving. He's quite a difficult horse to place at the moment, having won the Britannia and been placed in Group races it's tricky to find the right spot for him. We've been patient. I'm confident he'll be a better horse next year - Simon Crisford, trainer.

quotes.race: Britannia Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: It was not the plan to make all. I said to Silvestre that Ostilio could be a bit gassy and to just hold on to him a bit as he's got a turn of foot - just try and stalk the best. Anyway, I thought he was going far too quick in front and that about halfway we had cooked our goose. But he knows what he's doing - Simon Crisford, trainer.

runners.name: Monaadhil
runners.comment: In fine form when last seen and will take some beating if picking up where he left off
runners.spotlight: Lost the winning feeling before registering three successes from June onwards last year (two C&D); big run in defeat last time and he'll take some beating if returning in the same form.

quotes.race: ROA/Racing Post Owners Jackpot Handicap
quotes.quote: It's nice to get his head in front again. Monaadhil likes a bit of cut in the ground, he got a lovely trip round and he won nicely - jockey Jim Crowley

quotes.race: Breeders Backing Racing EBF Maiden Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: I didn't Know how Monaadhil would go on the ground but he got the trip well on it. He'd done plenty of work and was pretty fit. He chipped a knee last year and had some surgery which is why he didn't run at two. There might be more in the tank on fast ground - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

runners.name: Magicinthemaking

prev_owners.owner: Martin J Gibbs & R D John

runners.comment: Weak finishes the last twice but can pop up when written off and has the rail draw
runners.spotlight: Last four wins at Kempton but first three achieved here; weak finishes the last twice but can pop up when written off and has the rail draw.

runners.name: Lilandra
runners.comment: Closely matched with Monaadhil from their C&D clash in October but others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-14 on AW but peak RPR just 1lb below best turf effort and has theoretical chance of turning the tables on Monaadhil from their C&D clash in October (6lb for just over 2l); still, others preferred.

runners.name: You Are My World
runners.comment: Nowhere near form of 40-1 Kempton win (6f) the last twice and she has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Nowhere near form of 40-1 Kempton win (6f) the last twice and she has a bit to prove returned to further.

runners.name: Shining Crystal
runners.comment: Alice Haynes will likely get a win out of her but stall 10 tempers enthusiasm here
runners.spotlight: 0-17; beaten a neck final start for Adrian Murray and, although only third of seven at even-money, her debut for Alice Haynes was sound (both 6f); much lesser effort last time (8.6f) but could fare better over 7f here if stall 10 doesn't hinder; two pieces of headgear return.

runners.name: Cappananty Con
runners.breeder: Miss H Botterill & Mr D R Botterill

prev_owners.owner: Jim Biggane, John Waterfall & Dean Ivory

runners.comment: Career-low mark but hasn't tasted success for over two years and is 0-13 over this far
runners.spotlight: Career-low mark but hasn't tasted success for over two years and is 0-13 over this far.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Win At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: I was caught in a pocket at one stage on Cappananty Con, but he did it well when getting out although it was a bit tight late on - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey.

quotes.race: Tadwick Handicap
quotes.quote: Cappananty Con has been freshened up since he joined us and was probably in front soon enough at Lingfield last time. He's never won on turf, which was the only question mark, but racing off 10lb lower with Rhys's 7lb, meant we thought if he was going to win today would be the day. There's no reason why he couldn't go in again and he's not going to go up much - Michael Attwater, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a good gallop which suits Cappananty Con as he stays 6f - Joshua Bryan, jockey.

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: I probably gave Cappananty Con a little too much to do and he's done well to win. The nice gallop suited and he stayed on really well late on - Robert Winston, jockey.

runners.name: Nivelles Magic
runners.comment: Couldn't back up pleasing stable/handicap debut 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Last or second last in three novice/maiden runs for Henry Candy last year; close fourth when 150-1 for stable/handicap debut couldn't be backed up 13 days ago and she's passed over.

runners.name: Thaayer
runners.comment: Best run for a while 13 days ago and could finish off better back a furlong here
runners.spotlight: Exactly two years since his last win; best run for a while at Southwell 13 days ago and he could finish off better back a furlong here.

runners.name: Bo Taifan
runners.comment: Length behind Thaayer when back from monster layoff at Southwell four weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Length behind Thaayer when back from monster layoff at Southwell four weeks ago; remains best watched.

3:55.race_name: At The Races App Form Study Handicap

runners.name: Skilled Warrior
runners.comment: 0-7 for current yard but was in decent form here when last seen in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo who is 0-7 for current yard but he was in decent form here (1m/1m2f) when last seen in the autumn; each-way claims if primed after 160 days off.

stable_tour.quote: He won once for Johnny Murtagh at Roscommon in September before joining us in the spring. He has had two runs for us, the first rather disappointing, but I thought he ran with more promise last time out when third at Newcastle. He certainly works like a much better horse at home than he has shown on the course, so I am hopeful that when we can get it all together with him he can do well. He does not like the ground too fast. 22-06-22

runners.name: Ron O
runners.comment: Won over 7f here last week; 5lb penalty demands more but thriving and might find it
runners.spotlight: Fourth AW win (including two over C&D) since December when seeing off seven rivals over 7f here last week; not obviously well treated under a 5lb penalty (new mark due to be 2lb lower) but still respected as an in-form sort.

runners.name: Outsmart
runners.comment: C&D winner on 2022 reappearance; yard in reasonable form; not discounted
runners.spotlight: C&D maiden winner on last year's reappearance and placed twice off only slightly lower marks at the end of last summer; yard in reasonable form; not discounted.

runners.name: Streak Lightning
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Club And Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Back to winning ways over 7f here 13 days ago; fine at 1m; respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Ruth Carr has her team in good form and this one resumed winning ways over 7f here 13 days ago; did that fairly comfortably and was successful over 1m earlier in his career so he merits respect up 4lb.

runners.name: Gainsbourg
runners.comment: Three wins for Ed Bethell in 2022 but well beaten in hurdle and C&D handicap for new yard
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins for Edward Bethell, the latest of them off a 4lb lower mark in September; well beaten over hurdles on his stable debut and fared no better back on the Flat here last month; has something to prove for now.

stable_tour.quote: He opened his account two starts ago over 1m at Hamilton and then found the ground too quick at Beverley. We'll wait until the ground eases a little - proper good ground would be fine. His handicap mark of 70 is okay and he has proved he can win off that when things are right. 25-08-21

runners.name: Abnaa
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: Added three more Tapeta wins in January/February but form has dipped since
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner on Tapeta, including three times in January/February, but his form has dipped of late (last of eight to Ron O here last week).

runners.name: Vindobala
runners.comment: Four-time course winner but refused to race here last month; only sixth at Southwell since
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over 7f/1m here, the latest in February; however, she blotted her copybook when refusing to come out of the stalls here last month and performed no more than respectably when sixth at Southwell last week; others are preferred.

runners.name: Star Shield
runners.comment: Only just failed to get up over C&D latest and looks ready to win again
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D scorer who only just failed to get up over C&D last month and the winner has gone in again since; needs things to go right to some extent but he's capable of winning off this mark.

quotes.race: Racing UK Extra On racinguk.com Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Star Shield ran well over 7f at Newmarket on debut and took a small step here to win. Yuga [Kawada] gave him a nice ride and I'm delighted for him. Thanks must go to Sheikh Mohammed Obaid for allowing Yuga to take the ride - Roger Varian, trainer.

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: Progresive at end of 3yo season and could be more to come in 2023; acts on Tapeta
runners.spotlight: Progressive at the end of his 3yo campaign, winning twice over 1m on turf; third on Wolverhampton's Tapeta on previous AW start; could improve again in 2023.

2:45.race_name: At The Races App Market Movers Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Wheres The Crumpet
runners.breeder: A F G & Mrs S L Brimble
runners.comment: Well held in three bumpers; outsider on Flat debut
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three bumpers, including on Tapeta here, and likely outsider on Flat debut.

runners.name: Alpina Express
runners.comment: Fair form on both starts and likely capable of even better
runners.spotlight: Has shown a fair level of ability when fifth over 1m here and 9.5f at Wolverhampton (Joyful Act half a length ahead in fourth) in recent months; extra yardage here in her favour; likely capable of better.

runners.name: Corymbosa
runners.comment: Only seventh on 7f AW debut last year but well bred and likely capable of better
runners.spotlight: Second foal; closely related to 7f 2yo and 1m2f Group 3 winner Aikhal (RPR 116); dam 6f AW 2yo and 7f turf Group 3 winner; never better than midfield on her 7f Kempton debut in November but her smart pedigree suggests she can go on to better things as a 3yo; longer trip should suit, too.

runners.name: Eva Rosie
runners.comment: 125-1, never involved when 7l sixth of eight on 1m course debut 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: 125-1, never involved when 7l sixth of eight on 1m course debut 13 days ago; likely outsider again.

runners.name: Joyful Act
runners.comment: Well bred; promise amidst greenness when fourth on recent Wolver debut; should improve
runners.spotlight: Out of 1000 Guineas, Irish and Yorkshire Oaks winner Blue Bunting; 5-2, showed promise amidst greenness (hung left under pressure) when fourth on 9.5f Wolverhampton debut 19 days ago, with the reopposing Alpina Express narrowly behind in fifth; can be expected to improve; one of two runners for her top yard.

runners.name: Sahara Mist
runners.comment: Makes obvious paper appeal; very interesting how she compares in betting to Joyful Act.
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to four winners, including the really smart Wuheida (7f-1m1f including French 2yo and US Grade 1; RPR 118); dam Fillies' Mile and dual Grade 1 winner at up to 1m3f in US; makes obvious paper appeal and it'll be very interesting to see how she compares in the betting to stablemate Joyful Act.

runners.name: Silk Bird
runners.comment: Fair form at 2 but might be vulnerable to some of the well-bred fillies in this line-up
runners.spotlight: Fair form when runner-up twice at 2, including on Wolverhampton's AW, but comes up against some well-bred fillies from leading stables here and suspicion she might be vulnerable.

runners.name: Calypso
runners.owner: Nas Syndicate, M Buckley & Mrs A M Hayes
runners.comment: Improved with each of his three 2yo runs; gelded since; 1m should suit; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of his three runs in the autumn, recording RPR of 76 when second of 12 at Wolverhampton 135 days ago (7f); 1m should suit and he moves into handicaps with untapped potential; gelded over the winter.

stable_tour.quote: He has had three runs and to be fair he should have won by now as he is a capable horse. He just came up against one last time (Wiltshire), which is how it sometimes goes. We will soon step him to a mile, and off an opening mark of 77 he should be competitive. Although he possesses plenty of speed I see no reason for him not getting 1m2f in time. 29-03-23

runners.name: Centre Court
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Promising return in a competitive 7f fillies' handicap on Friday; worth a crack at 1m
runners.spotlight: Still to add to her debut win last spring; creditable return to action in a competitive fillies' handicap at Lingfield on Friday (7f); worth a crack at 1m.

runners.name: Calluna
runners.breeder: Hnr Nothaft Racing &more Than Ready Syn
runners.owner: Amo Racing Ltd And Jean-Etienne Dubois
runners.comment: One good run as a 2yo (6f); wind op since last seen; should improve now upped in distance
runners.spotlight: Second of 13 in a 6f fillies' novice at Wolverhampton in the middle of three 2yo runs; had a wind operation since last seen; bred to appreciate this longer trip and she's one to note for market confidence.

runners.name: Time Traveller
runners.comment: Looks a likely improver for switch to handicaps; mixed messages for 1m  on paper; gelded
runners.spotlight: Promise in three runs over shorter as a 2yo, albeit he failed to build on his good debut run at Haydock (6f, good); mixed messages for 1m on pedigree but still open to improvement; gelded over the winter.

3:20.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Fade To Gray
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs J Davis & P Mitchell B'Stock
runners.comment: Comfortable 7f winner here in February; 1m should suit but Naxos has achieved more
runners.spotlight: Promising debut here (7f) in February and duly stepped forward to win a 7f maiden nine days later; had something to spare on that occasion but he will need further progress for today's longer trip (bred to stay) if he is to follow up.

runners.name: Naxos
runners.comment: 7f winner here on debut; too keen over 1m next time; gelded since; now tried in a hood
runners.spotlight: Attracted support before running out the ready winner of a 7f novice on his debut here in October; too keen when second to a promising rival at Kempton the following month (1m), after which he was gelded; remains capable of better and the addition of a hood can help; looks the one to beat.

quotes.race: Talksport Powered By Fans EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race worked out the way I wanted. Naxos was green at home and jumped out a bit slow, he got into a nice rhythm and when I gave him a squeeze he quickened really nicely - Kevin Stott, jockey.

runners.name: Mlle Chanel
runners.comment: Debut win came in modest Chester novice; not disgraced in Listed race latest; 1m can help
runners.spotlight: Won a modest four-runner novice event at Chester on her debut last June (7f, good to firm); couldn't cope with Listed company the following month and absent since; today's longer trip should suit but improvement is required to make a winning AW debut.

runners.name: Sidneys Son
runners.comment: Finished out the back in two Redcar runs (1m/7f) on slow ground last autumn; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Finished out the back in two Redcar runs (1m/7f) on slow ground last autumn; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Keeponbelieving
runners.comment: 125-1 when a modest fourth on her Wolverhampton debut in October; tough task on her return
runners.spotlight: 125-1 when a modest fourth on her Wolverhampton debut in October; tough task on her return.

2:10.race_name: Sky Sports Racing HD Virgin 535 Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Vissani
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan
runners.comment: More promise last time (8.5f) and return to middle distances a plus; down in grade too
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner when trained in France; it's been tough going for this yard but there was much more promise when a keeping-on sixth over the extended 1m at Wolverhampton 19 days ago; going back up in distance can help and this drop into 0-55 company also likely to be beneficial; check betting.

runners.name: Fire Eyes
runners.comment: Struggled for this yard last year; has won over 1m4f and on a lowly mark; risky
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a 1m4f novice auction event at Kempton in August 2021, her final start for George Boughey; disappointing in 2022 but she starts this campaign off a much-reduced mark as a consequence; risky.

runners.name: International Law
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: In good order for much of the winter and returning to this trip in his favour
runners.spotlight: Successful over this trip at Southwell in October; several good runs in defeat of late and returning to 1m4f should be beneficial; shortlist material.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Racing Cash Out Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought I was going to get there from about ten strides from the line and then on the nod I thought International Law got it as well - he's a big, long horse and my body was upside David's. He's definitely improved since being gelded. He has odd tendencies but he showed a game attitude today, which he hasn't always done - Tom Marquand, jockey.

runners.name: Amourie
runners.comment: Pick of form in last 5 months gives her solid claims, including latest Southwell second
runners.spotlight: Southwell winner in December off 3lb lower; back to best when second to warm favourite back at that track 13 days ago; very dangerous with a repeat.

runners.name: Selfish Brian
runners.comment: Infrequent winner but some good runs this winter and conditions no bother; place chance
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but he has run some good races in defeat this winter and conditions shouldn't be an issue; each-way claims again.

runners.name: We Still Believe

prev_owners.owner: Sam Farthing, Linda McGarry & Ken Nicol

runners.comment: Revived by new yard, winning over 1m2f here last month; contender despite a 3lb rise
runners.spotlight: Rediscovered his spark for new yard, chasing home a well-treated opponent here last month before seeing off eight rivals nine days later (both over 1m2f); 3lb rise not excessive and should stay this extra yardage; high on the list.

runners.name: Lituus
runners.owner: Imperial Racing, J Blackburn & G Tuer
runners.comment: Not progressing and his stamina looked stretched by this trip at Southwell last time
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who doesn't appear to be progressing; stamina looked stretched at Southwell a fortnight ago and others make more appeal.

runners.name: Ideal Dream
runners.comment: Yet to show a huge amount and hopes are pinned on the new trip giving her a lift
runners.spotlight: Just modest form in her four starts, failing to improve for the switch to handicaps over 1m2f here three weeks ago; dropped 4lb and now upped in trip but still easy enough to have reservations about.

quotes.race: Belhaven For Macmillan May Handicap
quotes.quote: Visitant won first time out last year and is a horse that runs well fresh. He's proved he stays now and the way he finished off that race suggests a mile and a half will suit. We have plenty of options for him now but he won't be out again quickly as he seems to need a break between his races - Nick Saint, assistant to trainer David Thompson.

runners.name: John The Pirate
runners.comment: Not progressing and he needs the additional furlong to spark something extra
runners.spotlight: No progress since handicapping and hopes here appear to rest on the longer trip and Harry Burns taking over from a 7lb claimer.

runners.name: Buford

prev_owners.owner: Messrs T And P Brierley And G Tuer

runners.comment: Chance on his penultimate 2nd at Wolverhampton; 2m perhaps stretched him latest
runners.spotlight: Kept on for second in a classified event at Wolverhampton last month (1m4f); didn't benefit from the step up to 2m at Southwell a fortnight ago but not discounted back in trip.

runners.name: Milltown Lily
runners.comment: Modest maiden who looks vulnerable, even at this low level
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden; off since running out and unseating her rider over hurdles in December; vulnerable, even at this level.

5:40.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap

runners.name: Merricourt
runners.comment: Multiple winner over further; low-key return last month; 6f a question mark
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner over further; low-key return to action over 7f here 13 days ago; down in class but something to prove on this first crack at 6f.

quotes.race: Servisource Healthcare Claiming Maiden
quotes.quote: Merricourt just idled a little bit in front but he was able to correct him. He'll be an ideal horse for the winter around here and over jumps too - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Thaki
runners.breeder: Anglia Bloodstock Ltd & Mr C Humber
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and comes here in good form; sold for £5,000 last week; contender
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit and he's run with credit over C&D on his last two starts; sold for £5,000 last week and has joined an in-form stable; should give it another good go.

runners.name: Blazing Son
runners.comment: Ended 2022 on the up and made a pleasing return 3 weeks ago; firmly in the mix
runners.spotlight: Ended 2022 on the up, winning at Redcar and over C&D; solid return from a break here three weeks ago and he's one of the likelier winners.

runners.name: Patontheback
runners.comment: Of interest on his best form but may not be at that level after six months off
runners.spotlight: Won twice over this trip on Tapeta in late 2021 when trained by David O'Meara; retained ability for this yard in the second half of 2022; not impossibly treated ahead of his reappearance but he'll need to be cherry ripe to come out on top.

runners.name: Hey Mr
runners.comment: Down in the weights and could come on for recent stable debut; check betting
runners.spotlight: Looked very promising early in his career but things have headed south in the last 14 months; should be competitive at this grade though and a recent return to action/stable debut may have sharpened him up; worth market check.

quotes.race: Like MansionBet On Facebook Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Things hadn't worked out for Hey Mr on his last couple of runs, but the race was run to suit him today. He has a lot of speed and should make a nice 3yo - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Jems Bond
runners.comment: Three wins here already this year; battled well last time and a 2lb rise is fair enough
runners.spotlight: Three course wins this year, keeping on bravely over C&D 13 days ago; that effort backed up by the clock and a 2lb rise shouldn't prevent another bold bid.

runners.name: Sir Benedict
runners.comment: Comes here on the back of two runs where he's met major trouble; interesting back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Not easy to win with but he comes here in much better form than his numbers suggest, running into trouble on each of his last two starts; stepping back up to 6f may help and there's no doubt he has the ability to win off this mark granted a bit of luck.

runners.name: Dream Together
runners.comment: On a good mark and recent reappearance should have sharpened him up; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: On a dangerous mark now, some 7lb lower than when beating 14 rivals at Haydock one year ago; should be sharper with a recent run (behind Jems Bond) under his belt; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Great Standish Handicap
quotes.quote: I committed Dream Together a bit soon but the gap was closing and I had to get him through. He hit the front and showed a good attitude. He's a grand, straightforward horse - winning rider Jack Garrity.

runners.name: Mumcat
runners.comment: Good 2nd over C&D last time; has some quirks but new cheekpieces could help; chance
runners.spotlight: Has a few quirks and a refusal to settle often holds her back; has the ability to win off this sort of mark though and she was a good second here three weeks ago; in the mix and the cheekpieces could spark a bit more from her.

runners.name: Tathmeen

prev_owners.owner: King For A Day & Antony Brittain

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on his last two starts; each-way claims once again
runners.spotlight: Finished with a flourish to take third over C&D (behind Jems Bond) 13 days ago and better form when second in a Class 5 here three days later; no obvious reason why he wouldn't give it another good go.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Score At Betway Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: He has to be ridden that way and TATHMEEN loves it here. He just finds his stride a lot better here. At Southwell the last day, he's a hold-up horse and you can't get into the race, really. He has proved he is better on this straight track. He sees it all the way out here, but always does keep a bit for himself - Cam Hardie, jockey

quotes.race: Compton Beauchamp Estates Ltd EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Tathmeen is lovely colt and always has been. He's taken time and we'll take our time with him. The ground is not really important but he handled it - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Brides Bay
runners.comment: 0-11 but resumes on a good mark and she's had wind surgery; should win races this year
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Richard Hughes; shaped okay on her stable debut at Ripon last September and slower ground may not have suited next time; has had a wind op since then and she appeals as the type to win races this season; perhaps not this one after 192 days off though.

runners.name: Merry Secret
runners.comment: C&D win last month and had a valid excuse last time; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Returned from a four-month break to win a C&D handicap last month, keeping on well; fluffed the start (blindfold removed late) over 7f 13 days ago; one to consider.

5:05.race_name: At The Races App Expert Tips Handicap

runners.name: The Kings Men
runners.comment: Hasn't built on his debut promise but the switch to handicaps could spark something extra
runners.spotlight: Promising debut over C&D in September but he failed to build on it in three subsequent runs; gelded since last seen; makes handicap debut at a realistic level.

runners.name: Hidden Code
runners.owner: Ownaracehorse Ltd, O Pears & A Caygill
runners.comment: Slowly away in all starts; likely improver now handicapping but such progress is required
runners.spotlight: Slowly away in all four starts; has hinted at ability and this Class 6 handicap offers him his first realistic opportunity; one to note for market confidence.

runners.name: Bella Kopella
runners.comment: Progressing well and latest C&D win well franked since; big player despite a 4lb rise
runners.spotlight: Record since switched to handicaps reads -2121, the last three efforts coming over this C&D; had next-time-out winners back in second and third when comfortably winning last month, an effort backed up by the clock; looks well handicapped still despite a 4lb rise.

runners.name: Profitar Rules
runners.comment: Low-level form in five starts and a change of headgear isn't enough to tempt today
runners.spotlight: Low-level form in his five starts at up to 1m; today's change of headgear isn't enough to tempt.

4:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Ami Desbois
runners.breeder: E A R L Guittet Desbois
runners.comment: Two good runs a year ago but no show in last two starts
runners.spotlight: Two good runs a year ago but even a repeat of those unlikely to suffice; no show in last two starts; fell in 2021 Grand National.

quotes.race: Colin Baldwin 86th Birthday Novices' Chase
quotes.quote: It's a relief to get that out of the way, though I have always thought that Ami Debois would make a chaser, both in his schooling at home and the way he jumps his hurdles. We will step him up in trip now, there are a couple of races at Newbury that would suit him and if he keeps running well we will think about the festival - Graeme McPherson, trainer

quotes.race: vertem.co.uk Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ami Debois has been an absolute star this year, and it is nice to finish with a win. He won't run over hurdles again, he will go over fences in the autumn. He jumps well and stays forever so who knows, one day he might be a National horse - Graeme McPherson, trainer,

quotes.race: @totepoolracing Follow Us On Twitter Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought we were going to be put up on Tuesday given his form with Wholestone and Don't Hassle Hoff, so the handicapper's done us a favour. Ami Desbois is so game, and just a novice. We'll look at the Albert Bartlett, it'd take a good horse to pass him if it comes up soft - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

quotes.race: Roofing Consultants Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ami Desbois's form last season is pretty solid and he's strengthened up over the summer and grown up mentally. The plan is to go for a 3m novice at Cheltenham in December to see if he can take the step up. I think he will as he's a nice horse - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

quotes.race: Junior Great North Run Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We kept Ami Desbois back because we wanted to retain his novice status for this season. Kielan reckoned he wandered a little in front so hopefully he had something left - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

runners.name: Bennys King
runners.comment: Won both completed starts in hunter chases and not without hope; experienced rider
runners.spotlight: Formerly high-class handicapper and has won both completed starts in hunter chases this year, under a novice rider each time; now has the experienced John Dawson to help and no forlorn hope; one of two runners for stable.

quotes.race: "For The Love Of Racing" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bennys King has become progressive over fences and is still lightly raced. He always takes a run at the start of the season and we had him in the Silver Cup later on the card, but were unsure about the trip on this ground. I don't feel we're finished at three miles, but if we do it again, it needs to be on a flat track. He'll go up, but he's lightly raced so I think he can still be effective - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Two-mile-three around Stratford isn't Bennys King's thing, but I knew I had to get a run into him. He's a bit fragile and you can't gallop him as much as you'd like at home, but we couldn't find a race and that was available. We're disappointed not to get in the Ladbrokes Trophy today. Where we go next we don't know but it's upwards and he was progressive last year when we didn't overrace him and we won't do that this year - Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Garthwest Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: Bennys King has only had two runs for us and has done well so far. There's a nice two-and-a-half mile handicap for him at Warwick in February - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Douglas Family Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bennys King has been knocking on the door and the step up in trip has helped massively. I was keen to make it a bit of a test and he's stayed on to the line - Charlie Deutsch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's very good around Ascot and goes back there on Saturday. It may be that the handicapper needs to give him a chance but, when he does, there's still a big day in him. 16-11-21

runners.name: Coastal Tiep

prev_owners.owner: D Macdonald, I Fogg & P Nicholls

runners.comment: Respectable efforts this season; fourth in this in 2019 but will do well to repeat
runners.spotlight: Absent for two years before three respectable efforts this season, even if he was beaten a long way in the latest of them; fourth in this in 2019 but hard to see him matching that now.

quotes.race: BetVictor "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coastal Tiep is a bit of a playboy, but he's now won three races without us getting to the bottom of him. I needed to get him focused, but once he knew he was here to do a job he was away - Nick Scholfield, jockey.

runners.name: Cousin Pascal
runners.comment: Won this in 2021 and fifth last year; doesn't appear to be quite as good now
runners.spotlight: Won this in 2021 and bang there until two out in repeat bid last year (not helped by blunder five out); two wins this season but gives impression he's not as good as he was; still expected to be up there for a long way.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Walrus Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I've won this race four times now and this was the plan for Cousin Pascal - anything else is just a bonus. We won't go to Cheltenham and will head straight to Aintree. He's a proper Aintree horse so fingers crossed - Joe O'Shea, trainer.

quotes.race: Rose Paterson Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I must admit, Cousin Pascal has improved so much since he came - I've never seen a horse improve so much in my life. He came from Ireland, he's the cheapest horse I've ever been associated with. I think the bill for getting him vetted was more than he cost but he's never stopped improving - Joe O'Shea, trainer.

runners.name: Dalahast
runners.breeder: Suc Magalen Bryant & Mme P Cottin

prev_owners.owner: Magalen O Bryant & Mme P Cottin

runners.comment: Has proved very disappointing in Britain; blinkers fitted
runners.spotlight: Once quite smart in France but has proved disappointing in Britain; blinkers will need to provoke a minor miracle if he's to be involved.

runners.name: Dento Des Obeaux
runners.comment: Much improved when storming home in Irish hunter chase latest; hard to rule out
runners.spotlight: Had appeared to be a solid Irish pointer but no more than that until storming home in a Thurles maiden hunter chase last month (made all, 3m1f); won't be afforded the luxury of an easy lead in this but certainly hard to rule out given the latest performance.

runners.name: Dieu Vivant

prev_owners.owner: Lord Daresbury, Ecurie Mme Jacques Cypres & Laurent Couetil

runners.comment: Good efforts the last twice but hard to see him beating some of these rivals
runners.spotlight: Hunter chase winner last year and good efforts the last twice; hard to see him proving good enough to beat several of these, however; cheekpieces (no apparent help twice before) return.

stable_tour.quote: He has been quite tricky to train and his form is rather inconsistent. We have had his breathing operated on and the benefits of that are starting to kick in as his confidence is coming back. To be at his best he needs very soft ground and following a good run at Bangor when a close third in December he looks like he will not be long in winning again. 17-02-21

runners.name: Dorking Cock

prev_owners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: Capable of good form but was pulled up at Cheltenham last month; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Capable of very good form, as when narrowly beaten by a smart rival two starts ago, but not completely reliable and little impact at Cheltenham last month (28-1), when tried in cheekpieces (retained); others preferred.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier For The Northern Lights Two Mile Hurdle Series)
quotes.quote: Dorking Cock will never get to run in a 0-115 again so we had to chance it and it paid off. He deserves a break now and we'll look for a big handicap at the end of the season - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: starsports.bet Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The penny is just dropping with Dorking Cock. Two miles round here on this ground was always going to be right up his street. He is still learning but going the right way - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Drop Flight
runners.comment: Has run well in latest two starts, both under large penalties; can be considered
runners.spotlight: French chasing winner; fine seconds in latest two starts, behind Envoye Special at Ffos Las before finishing well at Newbury last month; can be considered on those although Ben Sutton unable to claim.

runners.name: Envoye Special
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Voir Sca & J Detre
runners.comment: Beaten by Magic Saint latest; could run well if taking to the test
runners.spotlight: Has his own ideas but beat Drop Flight well enough over this trip at Ffos Las before being put in his place by Magic Saint at Wincanton; again has the assistance of James King and could run well if taking to the test.

stable_tour.quote: I've always liked him but he was a big, backward baby last season which meant I could never train him as I wanted. I think some of these Coastal Paths need time, so that's what we've given him. He also had a wind op in the summer, since when he has improved physically, so I'm hopeful he'll win races over fences. Looks to be on a decent mark.

runners.name: Famous Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont

prev_owners.owner: D Biddiscombe, B Rousell, E Collins
D Biddiscombe, B Rousell, E Collins

runners.comment: Faded in closing stages at Cheltenham last month; leading contender if showing best
runners.spotlight: Very smart hunter chaser; looked a real threat at Cheltenham last month but seemed to find 3m2f too far; this trip ideal and has the form to go very close if the latest effort hasn't left a mark; tongue-strap fitted.

quotes.race: Betfred Steve Hope Walrus Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: That was impressive. We knew Famous Clermont had the engine and we've just done a bit with his jumping. He's grown up now and we're unlocking where we want to go. Cheltenham is definitely on the cards and Will [Biddick] is keen to go to Aintree. All options are open and we'll take stock and have a look - Chris Barber, trainer.

runners.name: Fier Jaguen
runners.comment: Blazed his way to three pointing wins this season; fascinating contender
runners.spotlight: Touched off at Chepstow a year ago in only previous hunter chase attempt but has taken his pointing form to new levels this season, with three devastating wins; habit of jumping right a concern but fascinating contender representing trainer-rider who landed the Cheltenham prize last month.

runners.name: I K Brunel

prev_owners.owner: Martin Redman, Lynn Redman, Maurice Thomas & Alan Hill
McNeill Family and Prodec Networks Ltd

runners.comment: Unseated at Cheltenham but had earlier beaten Not That Fuisse at Taunton; each-way hopes
runners.spotlight: Beat Not That Fuisse in good style at Taunton in February; stumbled and unseated before halfway at Cheltenham last month; 80-1 then but wasn't a forlorn hope going into that race, nor is he for this.

quotes.race: Prodec Networks Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to go to Aintree a few weeks ago, but the owners of I K Brunel wanted to come here and the horse had probably come down to a mark to be competitive, and he's not a bad horse on his day. He needs to be fresh and have nice ground, so I wouldn't run him on bottomless ground. He's a horse who has plenty of ability and the handicapper shouldn't murder us as the race fell apart a bit - Olly Murphy, trainer

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Stayers Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've liked I K Brunel since day one and we've had a few little hiccups. I don't think he was himself at Newbury last time, albeit he ran well, and he came back from Cheltenham all wrong when my horses weren't running great. He's won very well today on ground that was arguably too soft for him and he'll be a gorgeous horse next year jumping a fence. I'd be reluctant to take him to Cheltenham. I don't know if he'd be mentally ready for a big festival this year - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: smarkets.com Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: I K Brunel is a nice horse who has been showing me plenty at home. He's very raw. I'd say we'll run him in some good races now - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll switch back to fences and has plenty of ability. He'll start off in a novice or handicap chase in the coming weeks and will hopefully get his career back on track after disappointing last season. 21-10-21

He is a horse I have always liked but things did not go to plan last season, which saw his handicap mark drop from 140 to 127 over fences, but he got his act together last time at Newbury and took advantage of that mark. The handicapper raised him 3lb for that and he is clearly on a favourable mark. I am aware he is a horse best when fresh hence he has not run for over a month, but I hope to get him out in the next two or three weeks in another handicap mark, where he should be competitive again. 26-01-22

runners.name: Its On The Line
runners.comment: Good second at Cheltenham last month and that form puts him bang in the reckoning
runners.spotlight: Top connections; two point wins this year but rather unconsidered at Cheltenham last month (28-1), where he staged a late run to finish second (in cheekpieces, retained); possible he may lack the pace required for this but, in terms of form, is right up there.

stable_tour.quote: He has got youth on his side and had to carry a 10lb penalty when meeting Ferns Lock at Fairyhouse. He is progressing all the time and coming into it in good form on the back of two point-to-point wins, and he should run a big race. The stamina required for a Foxhunter should play to his strengths being a half-brother to Monbeg Dude. 25-02-23

runners.name: Latenightpass
runners.comment: Won this last year and similar preparation in points this season; obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Cousin Pascal in 2021 and went one better last year (always up with the pace); similar pointing preparation again and his ability to show his best around here is obviously a great asset.

quotes.race: Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I had the most fantastic ride off Latenightpass - he jumped brilliantly. He took to the fences really well last year and you're always a bit dubious as to whether they are going to like it again or not, and he definitely liked it! He's such a nimble, agile jumper, by no means scopey, just agile and nimble - Gina Andrews, rider.

quotes.race: Willoughby De Broke Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: That makes the early mornings worthwhile and Latenightpass was good, wasn't he? He won at Cheltenham in 2019 and is a really unexposed horse. He's been a lot of fun and I wouldn't mind a few more like him. We said if we ran well today and finished fourth or fifth we might go to Cheltenham for the festival and off the back of that I'd say we'd go straight there - Tom Ellis, trainer.

runners.name: Lough Derg Spirit
runners.comment: Second to top prospect last month but rest of form suggests he'll struggle
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to a top prospect in a Gowran hunter chase last month (first time in a tongue-strap); balance of form suggests he'll struggle.

quotes.race: Heath Farm Meats Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: Depending on how the handicapper reacts to Lough Derg Spirit's success we might give him one more run before Cheltenham, otherwise we'll go straight to the festival for the Close Brothers Novices' handicap chase - Ryan Tongue, racing manager to owners Mike Grech and Stuart Parkin.

quotes.race: Bet At racinguk.com Novices' Chase
quotes.quote: It was a nice start for Lough Derg Spirit. He made a couple of errors but they were nothing too major and they didn't knock his confidence. He's fairly straightforward and has been schooling well - Nico de Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Scottish Trial Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Supreme is something we'll have to think about for Lough Derg Spirit. He is still a baby and it might be that it's a year too soon for him. I was just a bit nervous after Burbank's defeat that it might be a bit sharp for him - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stallions EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Lough Derg Spirit will make a lovely chaser in time. I wasn't sure about the ground, but it was fine. I always thought he looked quite decent. Jerry had a problem pulling him up and I think he will be alright - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.name: Magic Saint
runners.breeder: S C E A Des Prairies Et Al
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Smart performer; easy winner at Wincanton latest; contender if truly staying 2m5f
runners.spotlight: Smart handicapper at best (peak RPR 160) and has taken well to hunter chasing; pipped by Benny's King at Hereford before scoring in style at Wincanton; slight doubt about stamina around here (pulled up in 2021 Topham over C&D) and Olive Nicholls unable to claim but still a candidate.

quotes.race: Mucking Brilliant Paddy Power Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Magic Saint has run in some good races. He travelled really strongly at Aintree but didn't get home and he did everything right today - travelled and jumped fantastically well - and good jumps at the last two sealed it. We've always thought he was a smart horse and fancied him for plenty of races so it was nice to see him put in a big display like that. He's on the verge (of Graded company). We took weight off today (with Bryan Carver) because we thought we were at the limit. It was a good performance so we'll probably look at a little Graded race. All of his best races have been at two miles and I suspect we will stay there. It will depend what the handicapper does and then we'll go from there - Harry Derham, assistant to Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Magic Saint probably just needed the race after a wind operation in the summer  - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Heed Your Hunch Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The switch back to two miles and the faster pace on this occasion has helped Magic Saint. He is likely to have an entry in the Grand Annual at the festival now - Megan Nicholls, representing her father.

stable_tour.quote: It was disappointing he failed to win last season, but he's not an easy horse to place; he is weighted up to his best in the better handicaps and has been found wanting in Graded company. He had a little setback since his last run but is okay now and should be back this side of Christmas. At least he is 9lb lower in the ratings, so that theoretically should give him a decent chance to get his head back in front, but he hasn't won for nearly two years now. And I still find it hard to work out what his best trip is. If things don't work out we have the option of going hunter chasing; my daughter Olive is particularly keen on that idea as she fancies her chances of getting on him! 31-10-22

runners.name: Matts Commission

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Rita Williams & Mrs Jackie Teal
Mrs Rita Williams & Mrs Jackie Teal
Mrs Rita Williams & Mrs Jackie Teal

runners.comment: Good pointer but looks outclassed in this
runners.spotlight: Has won 11 of 21 points; runner-up in three of four hunter chase starts but looks outclassed in this.

runners.name: Not That Fuisse
runners.comment: Beaten by I K Brunel at Taunton but may reverse those placings with top amateur booked
runners.spotlight: Successful in half of his eight hunter chase attempts; beaten by I K Brunel at Taunton last month but may reverse those places with Jack Andrews taking over from a novice rider; stable also runs Bennys King.

quotes.race: Eyes Down For The Cranmers Chase Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Not That Fuisse had run creditably at Cheltenham the last twice and as stepping up in trip for the first time which seemed to suit. But the key to him is the ground as he must have this sort of going to be seen at his best - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: racinguk.com Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Div I)
quotes.quote: Not That Fuisse is a lovely horse who we think quite a bit of. He travelled well and quickened up nicely when given a squeeze - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Colm [Donlon], his owner, is keen to go to the Hunters' Chase with him. He's learning to get three miles better than he ever did before now and he was impressive at Wetherby this month. He'll have a few numbers to find with the fancied ones on ratings but he's a strong traveller with loads of experience under his belt. He'll have an each-way shout in that race as he's been there and done it. 12-02-23

runners.name: Reikers Island

prev_owners.owner: D Cherriman, N Cherriman, T Cornes & S Holmes

runners.comment: Beaten nearly 40l when seventh in this last year; unlikely to do any better
runners.spotlight: Beaten nearly 40l when seventh in this last year and recent heavy point defeat doesn't suggest he'll do any better this time.

quotes.race: Axio Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Philip has been very pleased with the horses now and reckons they have turned a corner. Reikers Island frightened himself a bit when he fell at Exeter, but he showed a great attitude to get up here - Richard Johnson, jockey.

runners.name: Rewritetherules
runners.comment: Badly out for form this season
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in hunter chases last April but has shown nothing since.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Hunters Chase for the Bishopscourt Cup
quotes.quote: Rewritetherules did it nicely. It wasn't the strongest race and he'll never get a chance like it again but it's very important to me because the owners were here from Naas (O'Rourkes) and they would love to win this Cup and it's great to be bringing it home to them. The plan was last year but it was called off so we had to re-route. He wants good ground so we left him off for the winter. We've got a choice how, we could go hurdling or chasing, I wouldn't even mind leaving him for this next year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Glenview And Rathbarry Stud Novice Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Rewritetherules is a nice horse. He was too keen today and when he learns to switch off he'll be a proper horse. More than likely he'll go to Stratford. I think he's a good replacement for Hidden Cyclone - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: Sir Jack Yeats
runners.comment: Completed all five attempts over C&D but unlikely to trouble a few of these now
runners.spotlight: Has completed all five C&D attempts (two in this race) but not as good as he was and well beaten by Bennys King at Fakenham last month.

quotes.race: Fakenham Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: It was probably trainer error at Kelso, I'd left a bit too much on Sir Jack Yeats, but I knew he'd come on for it. We'll go straight to Aintree now, he'll be a fresher horse than he was last year - Richard Spencer, trainer.

quotes.race: Oulart Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: We don't have any plans for him but we will look for something in about three weeks or so. We never worried about the ground for Sir Jack Yeats. The blinkers helped him - Ellmarie Holden, trainer

quotes.race: EY Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: I thought he might have it in him today, he was working brilliantly and was flying at home - Ellmarie Holden, trainer of Sir Jack Yeats

runners.name: Sixteen Letters
runners.comment: Reliable pointer but hard to see him proving up to this task
runners.spotlight: Reliable pointer but has twice had a distant view of Famous Clermont in the last year; hard to see him proving good enough.

runners.name: Step Back
runners.comment: Once smart but now in decline and usually seen on right-handed courses
runners.spotlight: Very much in his dotage now and behind two of these at Taunton two starts ago; usually kept to right-handed tracks and likely to find this well beyond him; pulled up in 2019 Grand National on sole outing here.

quotes.race: bet365 Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Step Back will be aimed at the National next year. I'm afraid the handicapper might murder us for that, though - Sara Bradstock, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ludlow Point To Point 1st April Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We bought Step Back to go chasing, but he's taken a bit of time to settle in so we came here for his first run. On that I'd like to think he's entitled to take his place in the big 3m hurdle at the Grand National meeting - Sara Bradstock, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Time Leader
runners.owner: G&S Capper, M&C Kennerley, M Loran, L Doyle

prev_owners.owner: G Capper M Kennerley L Doyle & M Loran

runners.comment: Two hunter chase wins this season but pulled up latest, when reportedly bled
runners.spotlight: Two hunter chase wins this year and impressed in the second of them, at Stratford; reportedly bled when pulled up at Carlisle since and even a return to his best not enough; yard also runs Cousin Pascal.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We wanted to get Time Leader switched off as previously he was running with the choke out. He's a big horse and we've already schooled him over fences, and we probably won't hang around too long over hurdles - Tim Reed, trainer.

runners.name: Wagner
runners.comment: Two hunter chase wins last year but recent pointing form is modest
runners.spotlight: Two hunter chase wins last year but below his best since; modest pointing form this year, including a win; no real appeal.

runners.name: Winged Leader
runners.owner: Samuel John Hegarty & Miss Jennifer Okane

prev_owners.owner: Miss Jennifer O'Kane & Samuel John Hegarty

runners.comment: Only one defeat in last nine races; serious contender on first attempt over these fences
runners.spotlight: His only defeat in his latest nine starts came when collared at Cheltenham last March; has been mopping up Irish points this season and this has been the aim; first attempt over these fences but serious challenger.

quotes.race: St. James's Place Festival Challenge Cup Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: It's just sickening to get chinned like that after Winged Leader has given such a great performance. I'm gutted. Not only for myself, but for David Christie and the horse. He was just so good, he's so, so tough and jumps and stays. Jamie [Codd] just came to me and in fairness we were getting racing a bit early, but I didn't want to let him head me. If Patrick had come to me a little sooner we could maybe have fought, but he just went past me in the last stride. We can come back, but it's so hard to take after a performance like that. He wears his heart on his sleeve, and to be nipped like that - Barry O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Thurles Racecourse Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: I thought Winged Leader was very good beforehand and I was very happy coming here. I thought he had improved a lot from last year. We have deliberately campaigned him fresh this year because we'll aim for some of the bigger targets in the spring. He'll get a Cheltenham entry, as will Vaucelet, although I've always thought he'd be a fair horse for Aintree. The rain is bound to come and Naas can get very heavy so it might be too close to Cheltenham. One week changes a lot in a horse's life but at this moment I'm very happy to give him a Cheltenham entry - David Christie, trainer.

quotes.race: Hamilton Architects Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Winged Leader is only six and he is a proper horse. I have ambitions with him. The whole thing with him was never to get too carried away and just take it wee steps at a time. If we did that, the horse would come to us. If we did the opposite we would ruin him - David Christie, trainer

runners.name: Write It Down
runners.comment: Likely to find this much too difficult
runners.spotlight: Modest performer; long way behind Famous Clermont at Haydock and beaten in a point since; likely to struggle.

2:55.race_name: Alder Hey Aintree Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Ahoy Senor
runners.comment: Successful in Grade 1 novice events at this meeting for the last two years; respected
runners.spotlight: Made the running until falling six out in the Cheltenham Gold Cup; his jumping remains haphazard at times but he's high class on his day and is now bidding for an Aintree festival hat-trick, having won Grade 1 novice events (hurdles/fences; on good to soft) at this meeting for the last two years; respected back here.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor just a monster. In my mind we would take a lead but Derek (Fox) said he was going to go forward. He's just fantastic with the horse and they both trust each other. It's just nice to see our monster back. He's just starting to grow up and he's a phenomenal horse. We'll have to go for the Gold Cup. We said we would see what happens today but I think he's earned his place there - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Derek said that Ahoy Senor ran a bit free and it took his energy away. I'm just delighted he's back safe - that's the important thing. We'll see how he is over the next few days. It's his first run of the season. I think we'll stick with the plans that we had and probably go to Aintree for the Many Clouds Chase - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor is a serious classy horse and I think he's still learning on the job. He was pretty free early on and then he got into a nice rhythm jumping and he's done it really well. The best I ever felt with him was over hurdles here last year and for some reason this track might just play to his strengths. He's been a marvellous horse all season and he hasn't run a bad race - Derek Fox, rider. You are dealing with an elite athlete and I just wanted him to prove it. That's why I get emotional. He's as good as I've come across, and I'm talking about Carvills Hill and Granville (Again) there - Peter Scudamore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted with Ahoy Senor. That's made a man of him today. He's won his novice chases by jumping better than anything else and it's been at a steadier pace. He had to really fight out there - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Towton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted with that. Ahoy Senor took a few fences to warm up but this is a brilliant track to bring him to as it's a galloping course with big fences.
