He's a huge horse and he needs big fences to respect them. We didn't lose anything in defeat at Kempton and he will probably go for the Brown Advisory. He is still a novice, he's got an immense talent but we're still crafting him - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes John Francome Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ahoy Senor has got no experience but has jumped round there and it's the ability he has. It's phenomenal to be part of it. We knew he was a good horse at home; you just have to look at his stride and how he gallops. He was entitled to win on his handicap mark. The Kauto Star is on the agenda - and he did jump a bit right. He's not the finished article yet - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Isn't Ahoy Senor just a super horse? He just gallops and jumps. I saw his point-to-point win and he did the same. This was only his second hurdles run but we had such confidence in him at home. He ran so well over two miles four at Ayr and we knew he'd keep on galloping. I can't believe we managed to get him beat in a bumper but jumping takes him to another level. I can't wait for him to go chasing - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't bring his A game at Wetherby. He rushed his jumping and was just too fresh. It was probably a mistake running him and perhaps we'll start over a shorter trip next season but he always comes on for his first run. We were tempted to enter him for the Betfair Chase when we saw there were so few in it but we decided to keep our feet on the ground and hope he can show his best in the Many Clouds Chase at Aintree next month. We're bloodied but unbowed. 09-11-22

What a wonderful horse to have in the stable. He progressed all last season, which culminated in victory in the Grade 1 Mildmay Novices' Chase at Aintree, following a brave second to L'Homme Presse in the Brown Advisory at Cheltenham. It was in the spring that he really made serious progress and it looks as if history is about to repeat itself this term. At home he gives the impression that he's really starting to come to himself again. It looks to be all systems go again and he'll run in the Cotswold Chase at Cheltenham on Saturday or we may wait a few days and save him for the Denman Chase at Newbury. After that all roads will lead to the Gold Cup followed by the Bowl at Aintree. He loves that time of the year and he's set for a busy few weeks when we get there. 25-01-23

runners.name: A Plus Tard
runners.comment: Has a question to answer at present but best form gives him an outstanding chance
runners.spotlight: Has a question to answer having been pulled up in both outings this term, although had no luck (badly hampered after six out, unable to recover) in the Cheltenham Gold Cup on latest; highly impressive in that race and the Betfair Chase last season, both on good to soft; would have the best chance if surging back to that form.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought A Plus Tard was very unlucky. He had to jump two horses sadly and that was it. Rachael said she was really happy with him at the time, tracking Paul, and all was good. But it's the luck of the draw. I'm happy. He looks back now and it was just unlucky. He needs to go left-handed, so I suppose maybe Aintree. Rachael did the right thing. She pulled him up as she knew he wouldn't win - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was never that happy, to be honest, it was never happening. When I did decide we were going to pull up, A Plus Tard did stop very quickly under me. He was very easy to pull up. He seemed fine trotting back but as I say I was never that happy through the race. It could possibly be the ground but he's a very classy horse and I was hoping that wouldn't have been an issue that would make him pull up. We'll see - Rachael Blackmore, jockey.   It was obviously too bad to be true. We'll get A Plus Tard home. He was in mighty form coming over. But he looked laboured, didn't he? Maybe it was the ground but I don't want to give any excuse, it was just too bad to be true and that's it. He seemed good coming in but we'll scope him and check him and go through everything with him and see. It's very unlike him - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To be honest I didn't question any of it too much (last year), but Rachael said to me about three weeks ago that she was kicking herself and she wanted to ride A Plus Tard to use his pace. I said to her to do whatever she wanted and I thought she was very brave and brilliant. It was an incredible ride - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was fantastic. Rachael was brilliant and so was A Plus Tard. With his preference for a left-handed track, it just seemed a good race to go for. I was sick of getting beaten in the Fortria in the last two seasons over two miles. It's a fantastic race and we're very lucky to win it. He has so much class. He's a 7yo and he's achieved a hell of a lot for a horse his age. The Savills Chase (at Leopardstown over Christmas, which he won last year) seems the sensible way to go - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: WellChild Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good run and well done to Henry de Bromhead, an unbelievable result. A Plus Tard ran brilliant - Rachael Blackmore, jockey.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought A Plus Tard was staying on in the Ryanair last season and he definitely stayed on really well there - Henry de Bromhead, winning trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club "Loyalty's Dead, Live For Rewards" Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He had some great runs last year as a novice and I was happy with his first run back this season. We knew he'd come on plenty for it but the favourite was so impressive last year it looked like he'd be difficult to beat over this trip. I wasn't convinced this was our trip but the softened ground helped and he jumped great. We'll probably enter him now in the Champion Chase but in my head he was always going for the Ryanair. I believe he's better going left-handed and I couldn't find a race over two and a half. I think ground would come into play as regards plans (for Cheltenham). He'll probably come back for the 2m race [Dublin Chase] here in February - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of A Plus Tard

quotes.race: Close Brothers Novices' Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We have always liked A Plus Tard. He had a couple of good runs and beat Duc Des Genievres in Naas, so that was fairly telling. I was a bit disappointed the last day but he just looked tapped for toe. This looked the right race to go for once he got in - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Kildare Now Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: A Plus Tard did it really nicely and jumped brilliantly. He drifted a little bit right but it just seems to be a trait with him. There's a nice race at Punchestown next month over 2m4f which could suit him - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

stable_tour.quote: Touch wood, he seems to be in great form ahead of the Betfair Chase. He worked really well the other day and we're very happy. He loose-schooled in the indoor arena on Sunday morning and I was absolutely delighted with him. He looked amazing actually; he was prancing around the place and in great form with himself. I've been delighted with him over the last few weeks. People have asked me was I surprised with the way he won the Gold Cup, and I'd have to say yes. I certainly didn't expect him to do what he did at the end of it. What he did from the last to the line was extraordinary really. He was only upsides [Minella] Indo at the last and he went on to win by 15 lengths. It's incredible to think he was able to do that. Obviously, we'll have to see how the Betfair Chase goes, but I'd imagine he will follow a very similar path to last season. If it ain't broke, then we have no need to fix anything. 14-11-22

He has given us some of our most memorable moments, notably last year when winning the Gold Cup by 15 lengths from Minella Indo. I expected a big run when I brought him back in the Betfair Chase at Haydock, but it simply never happened. Once we got him home we tested his bloods and they weren't good. I had him in grand order and ready to run again over Christmas only for him to bang himself on the morning of the race, which was another big disappointment. He has trained nicely since and I'd say he's about where he was 12 months ago judged on his homework, which is very encouraging. Of course, it isn't ideal going back to defend the Gold Cup without a completed race this season but we have to deal with it. Hopefully he'll take a deal of beating again if he can get a clean run at Cheltenham. 01-03-23

runners.name: Bravemansgame
runners.breeder: Dr Vet M Guiot & Dr Vet B Stoffel
runners.comment: Won the King George then ran admirably in the Cheltenham Gold Cup; beaten twice at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Bit to prove back at Aintree having suffered short-priced defeats behind Ahoy Senor at this meeting in 2021 and 2022; highly progressive otherwise and ran admirably behind the outstanding Galopin Des Champs in a cracking Cheltenham Gold Cup most recently, having bagged the King George three months earlier; huge player provided he maintains that level of form.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I hate coming second, you know me, but I can't be anything but proud of the horse. Bravemansgame ran a blinding race and we'll give it another go next year. We'll see about Aintree, he had a hard race. The only places he'll run are Punchestown and Aintree, but we'll play it by ear and see how he is. If he didn't run again this season it wouldn't be the end of the world, but he's only run once since Christmas so we could go to Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a hell of a race. They went a good gallop and old Frodon gave them a good lead. Bravemansgame stayed on strong then and showed his strengths. He is just a maturing horse and we have trained him for today. We will go straight to Cheltenham now and we won't run him before the Gold Cup. Better ground he travels better on than he did today, but he dug deep and stayed on - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's what we wanted to see. We knew we had Bravemansgame fairly right. He hasn't been away for a gallop anywhere because I wanted to improve from now. We've got eight weeks to get him ready for the King George and he obviously won't run before then. Harry said that was the best feel he's ever given him. He felt he was in third gear all the way round, jumped fantastically well and galloped all the way to the line. Onwards and upwards - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame hasn't run his race. It was the end of a long season, I suppose. Harry said he was very keen going down and very keen in the first part of the race, he wouldn't switch off. If he'd have jumped the second-last upsides and got beaten I'd have thought 'fair enough' but Harry said he was beaten turning in. I haven't been hiding it, some of ours have been disappointing in the spring, some have run well and some haven't and that wasn't his true form. With a good summer out he'll be back next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Cheltenham Roarcast Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've left plenty to work on with Bravemansgame and didn't want to come here really fit and not improve for Cheltenham. We ran the likes of Kauto Star and Denman a bit short here and they came on. This fella hasn't run since Kempton and has been mad fresh. We haven't done much with him and we've left plenty to improve. I'm pleased with what he's done and we go into Cheltenham in good shape - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Kauto Star Novices' Chase (In Memory Of Nigel Clark) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame has it all, doesn't he? I did think the ground might be on the slow side but those good horses keep on galloping. He is improving all the time and we haven't been too hard on him. I learned a few lessons about how to train him from last year - but last year he was half the horse he is now and I think he'll improve as he gets better physically. That was a mighty performance. If you wanted to get him winning King Georges when he's nine and ten you would want to be minding him and not overdoing him now. I know the guys would like to go to Cheltenham but my target was always next year's King George. If you want to get horses like Clan and Frodon to their best you need to give them time to mature. You don't want to leave races at home - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Double Daily Rewards With Betfair Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame is improving physically and is obviously very good. He jumped fantastically well and has got so much scope that chasing was always going to be the big thing for him. He'll go for the Kauto Star next at Kempton on Boxing Day. It's the obvious race to go for. Three miles around Kempton will be absolutely brilliant for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame has got it all hasn't he?. Next year he'll make a super chaser and he's not unlike Denman in his physique, size and how he does things - he's probably got a bit more boot than Denman - but it's just nice to be talking about him in the same breath as Denman. It'd be nice if he turned out as good as Denman, but he's every bit as good at this stage of his career as Denman was at the same stage. He'll go for the Ballymore but it's just if we give him another run before we'll see. I certainly wouldn't run him on Trials Day at Cheltenham, but we'll see if we can find somewhere that I'd call a soft race. He'll get three miles in time, but doesn't need to do that now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Ladbrokes 5-A-Side On Football Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame did that well and we thought we'd come here en route to the Challow. We were going to go straight there but I thought he came out of his last race so well we'd give him another run before a step into a Grade 1. Testing ground would make me slightly nervous for the Challow as he's a good-actioned horse who wants better ground. He'd get further in time, but we probably wouldn't do that this season and he'll make a hugely exciting chaser next term - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Kennford Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame and the winner that day at Chepstow [Soaring Glory] will be quite nice horses. He is a big, progressive horse who's going to keep going forward and is a chaser in the making so we're thrilled with him. He'll be a super chaser in a year's time. He's a horse who could run in a Challow, I wouldn't be afraid. He's well capable of running in Graded races now so we'll see what there is - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The star of the show, with any luck! Clifford [Baker] and I looked at him at evening stables the other day and I tell you he looks absolutely fantastic. This time last year and the year before he always looked light after Christmas when we got stuck into him. Now he's matured, we've worked out how to get the best out of him and what to do in terms of his races and planning. He's at his best when he's very fit and very fresh. He's run well once before at Cheltenham, so the track is no issue to him and he was just a baby then anyway ? he's twice the horse who ran at the 2021 festival. He's so much stronger and with his two wins this year what more could you want from a horse who's going into the Cheltenham Gold Cup? I've got absolutely no concerns in my mind about him staying the distance, he travels nicely and he jumps nicely all of which is what you want. To me he's got everything you'd want in a horse trying to win the Gold Cup, it's just down to whether he's good enough on the day. He's got a lovely chance and I really am very happy with him. We've won the race four times with great horses in See More Business, Kauto Star and Denman. You need that really top-end horse and I'm hoping he has every chance in it. 20-02-23

runners.name: Conflated
runners.comment: Third in the Cheltenham Gold Cup; clear second in this race last year; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Met spots of trouble on his way to finishing third in the Cheltenham Gold Cup; dual Grade 1 winner at Leopardstown in 2022 and ran well (clear second) in this contest 12 months ago; only third-best on ratings in this field but has a solid profile and should give another good account.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Conflated has run his heart out in what was a fantastic race and I am very proud of him. If he is in good form he could go to Punchestown next but he has had a proper race there - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul (Townend) was going kind of steady on Kemboy and Conflated got a bit lit up going by the stands, so I let him go on and he'd probably be better off a stronger gallop but it was a good performance. I'm delighted and I don't know about plans, but he'd stay the Gold Cup trip; there are no issues with stamina - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Betway Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There were no excuses. Conflated ran his race. He has to go left-handed so I'd say that would be him for this season. He'll come back for all these type of races next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Gold Cup (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Conflated has a massive engine but he can be very hot and cold, and I was keen to try him in this race. We have the Gold Cup, the Ryanair and the Grand National as options for him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Foxrock Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: That was nice. Conflated is good horse and was a Graded horse over hurdles but he lost his way a bit. I fancied him in the Kerry National but he unseated at the third fence. It's great to win a nice pot with him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BAR ONE RACING Directors Plate Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Conflated was entitled to win and it looked a good opportunity prior to Fairyhouse and Punchestown, he won well and jumped great - Denis Foster, trainer.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Conflated is not a bad horse. He ran a few good races last year over the wrong trip. He was a fit horse today too. I don't know if he's a Grade 1 horse over fences but we'll see - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kettles Country House Supporting Fingal Ravens GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a nice horse, very keen at home and a chaser in the making. He had a nice run at Cork last time when learning a lot - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Conflated

quotes.race: Next Meeting Holy Thursday Flat Race
quotes.quote: Conflated is very tricky but is starting to get the hang of things now and is starting to relax. He is not hanging now and has lots of ability. I'd say when he gets a hurdle in front of him he'll be better again - Declan Lavery, rider

stable_tour.quote: He deserves to take his chance in the Gold Cup after what he did at Leopardstown over Christmas. That was as good as he's ever been. His jumping was good and he travelled beautifully through the race. He's a very, very good horse on his day and I can see him running a big race. I wouldn't underestimate him. 19-02-23

runners.name: Ga Law
runners.comment: Generally progressive but he's clear bottom of this strong pack on ratings
runners.spotlight: Good form at 2m4f in his completed starts this term, most recently fifth (albeit nearly 7l behind Shishkin) in the Ryanair at Cheltenham despite jumping none too fluently; held every chance when final-fence faller in major 3m handicap at Doncaster two starts ago; generally progressive but he's clear bottom of this strong pack on ratings.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Ga Law got injured during his novice season, I said to the team not to worry because we'll win the 2022 Paddy Power Gold Cup. It's one thing to say it and another to get him back from injury. We knew off a mark of 142 we had to have a go at this. He's not the finished article. He showed a bit of inexperience and there's things to brush up on. Who knows how good he can be? There's no set plan but he will step up in trip - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: "Rising Stars" Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the one thing this horse does is jump and GA LAW is electric at it, especially as he's a 4yo with so little experience. We were contemplating coming here or going to Cheltenham next week. I suppose when the rain comes and if it becomes a little softer, we wouldn't be afraid of dropping back in trip. He's got a bit of pace, but he strides on and jumps well. We were thinking about the Henry VIII as a possibility, but we'll enjoy today and plan afterwards.

quotes.race: Subscribe To Racing TV On YouTube Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I am absolutely delighted with Ga Law, coming into this with so little experience. He is very athletic, and he will go on soft ground. He may go for the Rising Stars at Wincanton next - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We'll give him December off as the Old Roan was relatively close to the Paddy Power Gold Cup, so we thought we would give him a moment to recover. We'll think about the £100,000 handicap on New Year's Day at Cheltenham perhaps, or step up in trip and go for the Sky Bet Chase at Doncaster over three miles. He does want further, but he's won very nicely over two and a half miles, so it's nice to have those options. 20-11-22

I hope he could be one of our standard bearers this season, having been off for more than 18 months. In his last season he won three on the bounce, including the Grade 2 Rising Stars at Wincanton, before finishing third in the Grade 1 Henry VIII Novices' Chase. His last run was when second in the Pendil at Kempton, where he picked up an injury that has kept him out of action since. We've given him all the time he needs and he's back in work looking great. The plan is to give him a prep run and then go for the Paddy Power Gold Cup next month at Cheltenham. He has dropped 8lb during his absence from 150 to 142, so you hope that if he returns to form he's on a very decent mark. We're very much looking forward to seeing him back on track. 05-10-22

runners.name: Shishkin
runners.comment: Class act when everything goes smoothly; new trip should suit on recent evidence
runners.spotlight: Has been a real powerhouse at 2m, including two Cheltenham Festival wins and a Grade 1 novice success here (in 2021); bounced back from a couple of notable flops to win the Ascot Chase impressively on his first crack at 2m5f, then put in an awkward round of jumping and tended to hang when favourite for the Ryanair at Cheltenham but finished with some purpose and grabbed second place close home; reinventing himself again and this new trip looks likely to suit on recent evidence; tongue-tie (fitted on last two starts) is now discarded; class act when everything goes smoothly.

quotes.race: Betfair Ascot Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The most important thing was upping the trip, I was always confident this was going to help Shishkin. They went too quick in the Tingle Creek and there was only one thing to do.  The confidence was that by slowing the pace he could then race on the bridle. He's not a brilliant work horse, so he's hard to assess that way but I think there's improvement, Nico said he had a good blow going to the last. It's been a while since the Tingle Creek but this was always the race we were going to come to. We got it done - I can't tell you what a relief it is. The whole game was different today. He was on the bridle today, that's what I wanted to see. By the third fence I was a happy man - Nicky Henderson, trainer.  That was fantastic. I knew Shishkin was going to let me know going into the first two fences how he was and jumped into the bridle and just kept finding lengths over his fences. I'm delighted, the team's done a great job to get him back to his best.  I wasn't sure what we were going to get, you can never tell with horses. I knew he'd done everything right at home but you don't know until you get to the track - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We are thinking, with all the great sages we have around us, that we need to go up in trip. Shishkin was flat to the boards there, his jumping kept him in it until three out and that did him in. He was fighting to keep there, but I honestly don't think he's a two miler anymore. He needs to go up, how far up I don't know. We'll see. His next run will definitely be over further. He was trying and his jumping kept him in it but he was flat to the boards. It happens, he's just lost that two mile speed and he's going to need further and he could be anything. We won't even think about how far for the moment, but we won't be messing about I can tell you. We'll try him over a trip - Nicky Henderson trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To be honest with you, you could nearly tell going to the first fence that Shishkin wasn't where he wanted to be and I knew why. He just couldn't get out of it (the ground). We are in very extreme ground. And yes, he's won in soft ground. But you're going round in heavy ground, and that is not his scene obviously - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It proves Shishkin stays very well and the nice thing is there is going to be a rematch now. We all hoped it would be a good race today as it would have ruined the Champion Chase if they didn't fight it out today. Willie and I are going to have to get them back from what they've done today as they've both had hard races. The nice thing is we were happy with him from last weekend and there were not going to be any excuses today, unless anything happened out there. Two out it looked as though we were on the ropes but one thing this horse does is try and find for you. It's the biggest fight he's been in today - the biggest fight they've both been in - and he doesn't give up. Nico said going to the last that he thought he was going to get him and he just picked up and stayed so well. But this is only round one and round two is for the championship - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Desert Orchid Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I am really genuinely thrilled with Shishkin, absolutely thrilled. Yes, it's a relief. I was nervous we weren't really there but we had to come out. He was in a bad place for three weeks, which is why he didn't run in the Tingle Creek, and then his tracheal wash backed up that he was wrong. We've just got back in time for this. The temptation was to wait for the Clarence House, as that would have given us another couple of weeks, but I was pretty keen to get out here and to get a run into him. It's great that it's over because it has proved one thing - he is as good as ever. Class is everything, isn't it - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When you are doing Cheltenham and Aintree it's not easy for them to do the two. It's only three weeks and they've got to be very good to do the two. Shishkin was probably just getting a bit lonely out on front. Nico felt they weren't going quick enough for him down the back. He's a very laid back horse, he's got a wonderful temperament. He's like that at home, he's not flashy. You wouldn't know he's that good - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shishkin has got a high cruising speed and sat on their tails. Nico brought him wide, he had plenty of horse from two out but he was impressive the way he came up the hill. How lucky can you be, we had the great days when Sprinter Sacre won it and then Altior came through and it's extraordinary to find another one. He looked every bit as good as the other two and he's a long way to go before he can be mentioned in the same breath, but he couldn't have done any more than that today - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shiskin felt great, I thought they went a proper gallop today. It was a real test in that ground and really hard work. I thought his jumping was very accurate and probably the best it has been so far. He has come into the race very easily and strode away. I don't think that could have been more simple for him. It was very straightforward. I was happy that he strode away all the way to the line and put real distance between him and the second horse. He had a good workout there, which is ideal for his prep. Onwards to Cheltenham and fingers crossed. - Nico De Boinville, rider

quotes.race: Racing TV Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shishkin has enjoyed himself and he's quite showy when he wants to be. You can see what he can do when he's long but you pray he doesn't go too long and do something silly to get out of trouble. Nico was most pleased by his jump at the last when he adjusted with no stride at all. It was the same when Altior came here, we let him bowl along in front. We've had a nice school and I love Kempton, it's great to start with as there are no traps. I would think he'll come back here over Christmas. - Nicky Henderson, trainer

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Going to the downhill hurdle Shishkin had a grab at it and he landed on all fours. From then on down the back it was really hard work, the ground is almost on the heavy side. It was a very rough race going up the hill, round the top there I got shuffled back. I tried to switch him out wide to try and get him travelling, give him a bit of light and comfort in himself. Then the horse has fallen in front of me and nearly knocked me over. Then it was just a case of picking up the pieces. He is so talented this horse, he has tremendous gears, he gets you out of an awful lot of trouble. Wherever he goes next season it might be that we've found another really good one - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was perfect. That's what you're trying to do and that's what those races are about. You're always nervous and they were very respectable opposition but Shishkin has got a lot of gears. He will run in the Supreme next. I don't think we were ever seriously going down the Ballymore road. He's got lots of speed and is a two-miler - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud To Sponsor British Racing Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shishkin is smart. It was unfortunate what happened the first time over hurdles, but Nico said it was like he learned something that day. He was quite gassy that day, trying to take the world on because he's enthusiastic. Today he was beautifully relaxed and never touched a hurdle. It was all very smooth. Not many horses quicken out of that ground, so you'd have to be impressed. He's got gears and might just want two and a half, but we'll see. I won't promise it's the Supreme. You better think about the Ballymore as well because Nico thought another half-mile might help. I'd been keen for another run (before Cheltenham) but he was very professional. We'll see how he comes out of it. It's experience that I want so I wouldn't be frightened of a little race. He can go anywhere but the timing of the Sidney Banks might be perfect. It's nice to know he can go on that ground because he won his bumper on good ground, so he's versatile - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Matchbook Best Value Exchange Maiden Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Shishkin is a wonderful big horse, still very raw with plenty of growing and filling out to do. He has showed raw pure ability and we're over the moon to see that today. He will need a good summer break to mature and Nico [de Boinville] was suitably impressed. We were hoping to take a lead but there was no pace so he let him bowl - Toby Lawes, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: Last season didn't go to plan as we missed the Tingle Creek, when he wasn't right after some health problems, but we got him to Kempton for the Desert Orchid. He won that and it was the ideal stepping stone to the Clarence House and that epic clash with Energumene. It was a thrilling race- I thought we were in trouble, but Shishkin dug deep to win. We were happy with him going to Cheltenham, where it rained heavily on Champion Chase day. I knew before the first something was amiss and it wasn't just the ground. A body scan revealed a rare bone condition, which caused intermittent lameness. His latest scans were good and I'm told he's not prone to it, so we're still quietly on course for the Tingle Creek at Sandown on December 3. I'm very happy with him and the long-term plan is another dust-up with Energumene in the Champion Chase in March. We've beaten him and he's beaten us, but hopefully our issues are behind us and he can get back to what he showed- when he was right- at Ascot. 24-10-22

3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Constitution Hill
runners.comment: Again dominant for Champion Hurdle win; should have zero issue with this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Dominant on all six rules starts (2m, heavy-good to soft) and won his fifth Grade 1 when powering clear in the Champion Hurdle last month; runner-up in a 3m point and the way he shapes in his races suggests he'll have zero issue with the step up in trip; it will be a shock if he doesn't win.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can do anything with this horse. You could jump a fence, you could go three miles. Constitution Hill has had six races now and has barely come off the bridle, but it won't last forever so let's enjoy it while we have got it. He is a freak. I said to Nico let's keep it as simple as you possibly can, and he did - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My gut feeling was always that Constitution Hill would go straight to Cheltenham as I'm not sure Haydock will do anything for him and neither would the Kingwell. Most trainers would agree that having an 'away game' as close to Cheltenham as the Irish Champion Hurdle is not the way you'd choose to prepare a horse for a race like the Champion Hurdle - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Fighting Fifth Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward. My main instruction from the governor was to keep it as simple as I can. Newcastle have done a great job with the ground, it's lovely good to soft ground. I could hear them behind me and once I turned in I just gradually quickened it up and went through the gears. Constitution Hill was very slick today. He's a joy to ride.  It was sensational, particularly how he quickened up in the straight. That was really good.  I've schooled the likes of Binocular at home and the best hurdlers hardly leave the ground. When I really quickened it up he was very slick. He'd jump a fence but for now we're fully down the hurdles route and let's see what the year brings - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill must be an extraordinary animal. This is a very, very good horse. Jonbon is a very good horse and for him to do that to him is remarkable. He's got an enormous turn of foot, he's always just racing two gears below everybody else because it's all so easy for him. Aintree comes very quickly; he could go to Punchestown and we'll say hello to Willie (Mullins) again and see what happens - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Tolworth Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The big question that everyone's asking me now is what will I do with Jonbon and Constitution Hill. I asked Nico if he thought Constitution Hill would go any further and he said 'no' so we'll be sticking to two miles. Would Jonbon go further? I don't know but nothing he's done so far would suggest he needs to. Nico said he knew within ten strides going to the start that the horse would be happy on the ground and that he was happy the entire way. He also said he couldn't believe how far clear he was without even having to give the horse a click - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Andy Stewart - Sandown Park's Great Friend "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Constitution Hill is the most extraordinary creature I've come across in years. He will go back to his stable and go to sleep now. I hope he's high class and he's definitely a chaser for the future - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I think everybody knows by now what an astonishing animal we're dealing with- one who was remarkably laid-back when he got here. We were almost asking Barry Geraghty, who urged Michael and me to buy him, for our money back! Barry promised us he was the real deal and he then did some fast work this time last year, and we've never looked back. He won easily on his debut under rules at Sandown before a flawless effort in the Tolworth, which took us to the Supreme at Cheltenham, where he produced an exceptional performance. He's strengthened over the summer, but I can't stress how brilliant his temperament is. That allows his talent to flow- and that talent is extraordinary. The aim, unsurprisingly, is the Champion Hurdle and a clash with Honeysuckle, which should be something to savour. The thought is a return in the Ascot Hurdle on November 19 as Epatante seems set for Newcastle's Fighting Fifth a week later. 24-10-22

runners.name: I Like To Move It
runners.comment: Soft going may not have suited in Champion Hurdle; won the Kingwell previously; e-w claims
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten sixth of seven in last month's Champion Hurdle and he weakened on his sole previous attempt at this sort of trip; however, the ground was soft for both of those runs and perhaps he's better served by a sounder surface; has won the Greatwood Handicap and the Grade 2 Kingwell Hurdle and he's an each-way contender if able to produce his best form.

quotes.race: Wincanton Jennings Bet Kingwell Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good, wasn't it? I Like To Move It always been a brilliant horse and we hoped he could do that back over two miles. I know we can't get anywhere near Constitution Hill, but we'll give him something to think about. We can't back away from it because there is nowhere else to go. He's right up at the top of the best hurdlers I've trained with Khyber Kim and The New One, who were placed in Champion Hurdles - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Greatwood Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was absolutely superb off 12 stone around there. Taking the hurdles out didn't help I Like To Move It but he was awesome. He (Sam) was very positive on him. He definitely would like softer ground and he stays the two miles well. He was unlucky in the Betfair. He is a proper horse. The International Hurdle (Saturday 10th December) here will be next. He will follow in the hoofprints of a good horse we had called Guard Your Dreams and The New One used to frequent this race before that. It looks quite busy, the Champion Hurdle, but that is the idea at the moment - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can't say from that whether I Like To Move It has taken a step forward from last month. The horses weren't anything like as good today, but he's got a penalty and his jumping was superb so he's exciting. The Betfair Hurdle could be a thought down the line but we'll have to see what the handicapper does. The main aim will be to come back here in March (for the Supreme) - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. It's not often you go out in a race and the plan with four runners, but a valuable race, was more about an experience so making sure it was smooth and he jumped well. If he could pick up plenty of prize money we'd have been happy but to have picked up and win like that shows the engine he's got as he was taking on hardy horses. Even with jumping a few inadequately he won nicely. He's scary good, because he's doing a lot wrong without winning. Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey

quotes.race: Myson Radiators EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Like To Move It was a superb bumper horse. He was a bit green over the hurdles, but he'll improve for that and the more you ask, the more you give. He's right up there with my youngsters, but I've no idea where we'll go next, somewhere on nice winter ground probably. He'll make up into a three-mile chaser in time - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Sceau Royal
runners.comment: Highly admirable 11yo but he tends to find a few too good in Grade 1s nowadays
runners.spotlight: Highly admirable 11yo who ran his usual solid race when second of five in the Grade 2 National Spirit Hurdle over 2m3f at Fontwell in February; however, he tends to find a few too good nowadays when tackling Grade 1s and that's likely to be the same story here; wears first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: bet@racingtv.com Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was a wee bit concerned because the weekend has gone awfully well, but Sceau Royal is one horse you could nearly set your clock to. He's spread a plate and given his knee a bang but apart from that he's fine. He always goes left when he jumps, you can get away with that over hurdles but not fences, that's why he never runs right-handed on a chase now. It's just what we wanted today and hopefully put him right for a return to Wincanton for the Elite Hurdle. We'd want a lot more rain before that though, I wouldn't want to run him on anything quicker than today, at his age we'll look after him - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal never lets me down. There were a lot of good horses behind him. I'm very happy with him and he got the trip - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal is a superstar. He's now won it as a four-year-old, eight-year-old and a nine-year-old, so what the hell was I doing in between, novice chasing. He's as good as ever, I'm convinced he is, if not slightly better. We know how to properly train him now and he's in a good place. He was never a brilliant work horse but he's now working as well as ever. He's definitely better - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal has been pretty savage at home this past week and this is the best ground we have had all season. He's very much ground dependent so if it was soft at Cheltenham we could wait for Aintree or Sandown, but it's a nice problem to have - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Elite Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal has had a couple of meetings where the ground has been ideal for him. On the soft ground I felt he had small wind issues and it's taken its toll, but he's been up against Altior for the last two or three years and has only been beaten two or three lengths. All credit goes to Anthony Bromley and Alan King for picking out the Welsh Champion Hurdle as his starting point. From then we thought about the Shloer Chase, but we wanted to come back here as we knew the ground would be nice for him. He's very, very versatile when he jumps a fence he's quick, but I'd imagine while we haven't got the penalties we might have a crack at these races and see where we are come Cheltenham and Aintree - Daryl Jacob, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal has run grand but not at one stage did I ever think we were going to beat him. He has run really well but been beaten by a champion - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal's jumping is his big forte, he's very, very quick over a fence. All the two-milers I've trained have all been pretty slow at home, he's a very slow horse at home this lad, I've got to be very careful what I work him with. I don't think Voy Por Ustedes and horses like that were very quick either - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Napoleons Casino & Restaurant Owlerton Sheffield Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I had been quite easy on Sceau Royal since his last run and so he should come on again for that. He is a very quick jumper, and that was a proper test as Harry (Skelton) set a good gallop. He perhaps didn't travel quite as well on that ground as he usually does, but I'm pleased with him all the same - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: randoxhealth.com Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I've always worried, certainly when Sceau Royal was running over hurdles, that he was 10lb below the very tops, but I think fences have improved him. You won't see a slicker round of jumping than that one. From the first moment we schooled him he has been electric. I knew that whatever happened today I would have no excuses as we couldn't have had him any better - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Stan James Elite Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The ground would have been as quick as Sceau Royal really wants but I think we have got away with it. He is very fast over his hurdles and not too bad on the flat so he's got plenty going for him. His next likely race could be the Fighting Fifth Hurdle at Newcastle at the end of the month but we will have to wait and see how he is as we also have the option of waiting and going for the Christmas Hurdle at Kempton - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal has always been a very good horse and he just disappointed in the Triumph and at Aintree when the horses just weren't right. He's had a good summer back at the stud and we've been thrilled with his work this autumn. We'll just creep away and see where he gets to. He's a horse we like but I'm not going to get carried away today - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red Chatteris Fen Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal is a fast-improving horse and had a nice workout. He's a classy animal and his jumping is getting better and better - Daryl Jacob, rider.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle Trial (A Juvenile Hurdle)
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal was a little bit unlucky at the beginning of the season, but we felt that the win at Warwick gave him confidence and certainly in his homework he was very progressive. What pleased me here is he galloped all the way to the line and hopefully that puts him in the mix for the Triumph - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Guy Salmon Land Rover Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sceau Royal is a decent horse and I was very pleased with that. He's very quick and is a proper little horse. He could go to Doncaster for the Summit Juvenile Hurdle next month - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a pleasure to have around - I could do with a few more like him! The old boy had a marvellous season, mixing hurdles and fences as usual. He was actually rated higher than ever over hurdles in 2021-22 and the way he ran when he was third in the Melling Chase at Aintree suggests we can certainly look at races over that trip again. As last year, he started off this term over hurdles at Kempton and won in the style that I hoped he would - a remarkable 17th career success that took his earnings to nearly £660,000. He'll now try to land the Elite Hurdle at Wincanton for the third season in a row. 19-10-22

He may be ten now but he had another marvellous season, mixing hurdles and fences as usual. He was actually rated higher than ever over hurdles in 2021-22 and he made a winning return at Kempton last month. Next stop will be an attempt to land the Elite Hurdle at Wincanton on Saturday for the third season in a row and the fourth time overall. He showed when third in the Melling Chase at Aintree last spring that he gets two and a half miles well enough for that trip to be an option again at some stage. 07-11-22

runners.name: Sharjah
runners.comment: 4th off top weight in the County Hurdle; he's an each-way possible if seeing out the trip
runners.spotlight: Multiple 2m Grade 1 winner (good-soft) who was a highly creditable fourth off top weight in last month's County Hurdle (2m1f) at Cheltenham; this 10yo hasn't been quite at his very best this season, and he's untested at today's distance, but he's an each-way possible if seeing out the trip.

quotes.race: Unibet Morgiana Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Sharjah is a wonderful servant to have around the place. I'd imagine he'll go back to Leopardstown at Christmas -Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll head to Punchestown with Sharjah next. He's very likeable and we're very pleased with his run, we just weren't good enough on the day. Honeysuckle looks to be very special - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Matheson Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He's like Santa, he rocks up here every year and always seems to deliver. He just seems to come alive. He enjoyed passing horses and he has a great turn of foot. He makes it easy and I'd love to have another go at the Champion Hurdle. We were further back than needed to be last time time - Patrick Mullins, rider of Sharjah

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: When I pulled out going to the last and got a bit of daylight I thought for five strides 'here we go'. But I knew I needed them to stop, the mare was the only one who picked up and she was gone. I knew I didn't have another gear to go. She beat us fair and square. Sharjah is wearing a tongue strap now and he's a bit older so he's handling the ground a bit better and that opens up more options. I wouldn't mind a rematch on good ground at Punchestown - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Ryanair Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That sort of ground makes a big difference to him. Patrick said the horse really enjoyed the conditions. That's his third big race win this year and while he will be entered for the Irish Champion Hurdle we might decide to and go straight to Cheltenham (for the Champion Hurdle) - Willie Mulllins, trainer of Sharjah

quotes.race: Unibet Morgiana Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He had a hard race at Down Royal last time and we ran him today in the hope he might run in the first three. So to see him win so easily was a surprise. He's been busy between hurdling and the Flat and probably deserves a break before coming back in the spring, but after that performance we might look at running him over Christmas. Willie Mullins, trainer of Sharjah

quotes.race: Guinness Galway Hurdle Handicap (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Patrick was fantastic on Sharjah, it is very tough for a top-weight to make all in a race like that. I thought he was gone halfway up the back but he got a nice run from two out and flew home. He did it well - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Gowran Park Racing Club Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The was a good performance from Sharjah and Paul was very good on him. Nobody wanted to make the running and he was able to use his speed to beat him. He got a great jump at the last when it was needed. He'll have no trouble going further - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paulstown Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sharjah did it well. He quickened up sharply when we were by-passing the second last hurdle and quickly put the race to bed. The ground is quite testing but he jumped really well. You'd hope he'll improve from the run - Ruby Walsh, rider.

stable_tour.quote: His main aim this season will be the Grade 1 Matheson Hurdle at Leopardstown's Christmas meeting. He was a bit later than the others coming back in but I'm going to step up his training and we'll try to get him ready to start back in the Morgiana Hurdle. Hopefully he might get a spin in the Champion Hurdle as well. 07-11-22

He has been a star of the yard with six Grade 1 wins. His last two visits to Cheltenham have seen him run big races when third and second in the Champion Hurdle. He has been placed twice behind State Man in Grade 1s this season. He has an entry in the Champion Hurdle again, along with the Stayers' and County Hurdle. 08-03-23

runners.name: Zanahiyr
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: 13l third to Constitution Hill in the Champion Hurdle; major player for the forecast here
runners.spotlight: Bang there in this race last year (good to soft) when a final-flight faller, albeit Epatante was travelling better; kept on for 13l third in the Champion Hurdle (2m, soft) last month and, although it's hard to envisage him beating the winner Constitution Hill, he's a major player for the forecast.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Zanahiyr ran a very good race. He galloped well and we're very happy with him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: WKD Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Zanahiyr did that well. He wasn't really doing very much, his ears were pricked the whole way, but it was very pleasing how he galloped to the line from the second-last. I can see him stepping up in trip at some stage this season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It was a great performance from him. It was a completely opposite race to the last day at Fairyhouse, we went very steady and he still won so it just shows that he can do it anyway. He only did what he had to do today, we're delighted with him. I think Quilixios is very good but this horse might edge it over him - Jack Kennedy, rider of Zanahiyr

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We thought he was nice at home. He did it well at Ballinrobe, and we thought he had come on for it. You're always a bit nervous when you see Willie [Mullins] taking you on with a dual winner out of France, so I thought it was a very good performance. Jack [Kennedy] said he travelled and jumped. He did everything very easily. He's not just a juvenile, he's big and strong and only going to get better - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Zanahiyr

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF C & G Maiden
quotes.quote: He's a lovely big horse. He was very babyish and even in Navan he really only got the hang of things up the hill. I knew he'd come on from it and he was a lot more on the ball today. I'll give him a bit of a chance now and we'll take it from there. He's a horse with a future. He stays well and has a great attitude. I'd say he's going to keep on improving and he has the scope to do it - Michael Halford, trainer of Zanahiyr

stable_tour.quote: He had a problem with his stifles earlier in the season but we've got it sorted now and that was much more like it in the Irish Champion Hurdle. We have the option of the Champion Hurdle or going for the County Hurdle or Coral Cup instead. He could be very interesting in one of those. We all know he's a very good horse. 19-02-23

runners.name: Epatante
runners.comment: Won this last year and every chance she'll be best of the rest behind Constitution Hill
runners.spotlight: Didn't have to be at her best for Grade 2 mares' win at Doncaster in January and disappointing in the mares' hurdle at last month's Cheltenham Festival; however, she won this race last year (good to soft) and there's every chance she'll be best of the rest behind stablemate Constitution Hill, which was the case in the Fighting Fifth and the Christmas Hurdle this season.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Yorkshire Rose Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Epatante felt fantastic and I thought she jumped well and travelled great. It's nice for her to pick one up like this. The team have got her in really good shape today. If she keeps progressing it will be interesting to see where everyone decides to go at Cheltenham - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've never seen Epatante in better form and Aidan said there that she's probably run as well there as she did when she won this on the bridle last year! She was only chasing shadows to be honest and that just shows what he's achieving, which is frightening really - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Aintree Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Epatante is on the top of her form. That was lovely and she deserves that, she's done nothing wrong all year. JP said at the beginning of the season the Fighting Fifth and the Christmas Hurdle are her golden aims. We halved one and won the other. You'd settle for that. She had a crack at the Champion Hurdle and she was an honourable second. She's massively improved on last year when things went badly wrong. There was a concern about the trip but round here this is about speed and that probably helped her - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They are two great mares. Epatante ran a great race and couldn't have done any more. She'd been going great and she's done nothing wrong. I'd have thought she'd run again this season but it's a question of where. Aintree comes quick and Honeysuckle will be lurking again at Punchestown, so where do you go? I put her in the Scottish Champion Hurdle this morning, as she's only rated 153, but that's a handicap and she's hardly going to come down now is she. I've probably blown that now - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She's got herself back. Epatante might be as good as she was when she won the Champion Hurdle, but the others might be better this year too. We've achieved our two goals (winning Fighting Fifth and Christmas Hurdle) and we'll see what happens next - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Fighting Fifth Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I had to commit a bit early and Epatante has run really well because I wasn't really happy with her on that ground. It was quite hard work and I wasn't going as well as I'd have liked two out and I ended up making a mistake because I really committed her and I shouldn't have done, I should have held on to her and nursed her a bit. She dug it out and the other horse is very tough as well - Aidan Coleman, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Epatante has run a great race, it was a very competitive Champion Hurdle. I didn't think she had the easiest passage through but I don't have any excuses. If you're very good you get out of difficult holes but if you're not quite going well enough then you can't. Fair play to the winner, she was exceptional. The winner is very very good and it's probably a better race than last year, that said we beat Sharjah before - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm not really sure what went wrong but the winner deserved to win. Just from turning in that usual burst of speed Epatante usually has wasn't there today for some reason. But listen, she'll be back - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Betfair Fighting Fifth Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a relief as much as anything. It shows that everything Epatante did last year, there was no fluke about it. I thought she was great, she's a proper hurdler. The great thing about her is you can press a button and off she goes - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought after riding Chantry House in the first race that the ground would be too slow for Epatante and she would struggle. I was worried about it all week yet every step of the way, she was a dream. We missed one or two just because she was wanting to get on with it and trying to take them on, so I was always trying to keep a lid on her. I was a little concerned about the ground and I was hoping and praying all the way through the race that she would keep travelling for me. In fact it was the opposite, and she was taking on hurdles when I was asking her to pop. I needed to cover Darver Star coming down the hill and I was just happy to play her late. She quickened and is just a very smart filly - Barry Geraghty, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Epatante was impressive wasn't she? I've even got to admit it myself, it was very good. We came straight from the Gerry Feilden, I wanted to go to Ascot but it's a good job we didn't. JP (McManus, owner) always wanted to come here and he got it right. He must've had more faith than me. I thought she was our best chance at Cheltenham last year but she didn't run her race. She did everything right up until then, and has done everything right up until now. She's lovely, has a great temperament and has a good attitude - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Where The Nation Plays" Intermediate Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: She was impressive and the second horse is no mug - nor is the third, actually. Epatante seems to have been favourite for the race all week but I rather fancied Elusive Belle. Epatante has really quickened up very well. She has some toe - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit Exeter Mares' Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Epatante had a straightforward task and she has done things very professionally. She had not run for a while but I was very pleased with her as she jumped better than she did at Kempton on her British debut - Barry Geraghty, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet At racinguk.com Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Epatante was working very well at home and this was a nice start for her to get the ball rolling. Her bumper form looked very good and she did it well today. She jumps well and has only schooled on the all-weather so far. There should be a lot more to come - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We don't know about her race yet and will keep an eye on the weather and Constitution Hill in the Champion Hurdle. He's got to get there and four weeks is a long time ? a week is a long time in a horse's life. She did prove at Aintree last year she stayed two and a half miles very well and it was great to see her win easily at Doncaster the other day. I know she beat nothing, but she showed what Constitution Hill has been beating. That shows how good he is if he can keep slamming her but she can then come out and also win easily. She needs to be supplemented but should be treated as a possible runner [in the Mares' Hurdle]. 13-2-23

1:45.race_name: Racehorse Lotto Manifesto Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
1:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Banbridge
runners.comment: Smart chaser who looked ready for return to 2m4f when second in Irish Arkle; rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Impressed when successful at Gowran (2m4f, good to yielding) and Cheltenham (2m, good) on first two starts over fences;   shaped as he'd be suited by a return to further when 10l second to El Fabiolo in Grade 1 Irish Arkle at Leopardstown (2m1f) in February, staying on after getting outpaced; capable of going very well but peak form achieved on good/good to soft and perhaps wouldn't want too much rain (non-runner at Cheltenham last month due to soft ground).

quotes.race: From The Horses Mouth Podcast Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Banbridge has taken to chasing very well. He's already gone a step ahead of his hurdles campaign and there's a long way to go until the next step but you couldn't be more impressed with what he's done there. He's a hugely exciting horse going forwards. I think we learned today that two miles is another option going forwards, his jumping was what you wanted to see from a two-miler - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Gowran Park Racing Club Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Banbridge jumped very well. We had schooled him a bit at home and he has been very good. You'd be hoping he might achieve something similar to what he achieved over hurdles - J.J. Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The standing start actually suited us. Banbridge was very sharp away, thank God, and I got a lovely position early. They didn't go very quick and he was always in his comfort zone. I wasn't confident that I would win until about ten strides after the last. I was always just conscious that something might get to me, but luckily nothing did - Mark McDonagh, rider.

quotes.race: Dunmoe Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a nice performance for a horse that really wants further. Banbridge will be a three-miler in time. I just thought that they might do him for a bit of toe but he's very tough and he jumped well up the straight. He wouldn't want it any softer than that. Next year he could be an exciting chaser, especially at 2m4f or further. He'll stay 3m. He stays, he's honest and he gallops - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's most likely that he will run in the Turners. I thought he ran really well at Leopardstown and he is going there with a live chance hopefully. He has strong course form which always is a help at Cheltenham so we are looking forward to him. 25-02-23

A very smart novice chaser who won twice earlier this season, including the Arkle trial at Cheltenham's November meeting. His last run was a fair effort when second to El Fabiolo who has not done the form any harm since. We missed Cheltenham last month with him as the ground was too soft, but he is in very good order and he is going to Aintree on Thursday for the Manifesto Novices' Chase which is a Grade 1 over 2m4f. He will be up against Stage Star amd Saint Roi so it won't be easy. His work has been very encouraging though. 12-04-23

runners.name: Saint Roi
runners.breeder: P E Guilloux, J Thomas & B Dasque
runners.comment: Very smart novice (third in Arkle at Cheltenham) but has stamina to prove now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Very smart hurdler (third in last year's Champion Hurdle) and equally as good over fences, seeing off the reopposing Visionarian to win a 2m1f Grade 1 novice at Leopardstown (yielding) over Christmas; another good effort when picking up the pieces for third behind El Fabiolo and Jonbon (Straw Fan Jack 16l behind Saint Roi in fourth) in Arkle at Cheltenham (2m, soft) last month; has the form to go close but he's unproven over this trip (faded into fifth on 2m3f stable debut and raced only at 2m/2m1f since).

quotes.race: Brand New Racing Post App Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought Saint Roi ran very well against Fil Dor, a horse who had already had a run, at Navan. If he'd won we'd be coming to this race anyway, so rather than running in another beginners' chase I said to myself 'Why not let him have a crack at a good prize?' He's a nice prospect for the rest of the season - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Saint Roi has run a super race. It was his best this year, so I'm delighted. Hopefully he'll build on that now - Mark Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I'm very happy with that. The race conditions suited him very well and that was a big advantage going into today. Mark [Walsh] said he was meeting the last wrong and just let him fiddle it. He may have been getting a little short of room at the third last when he made a mistake, I was worried that he was coming off the bridle but Mark said he was tight for room and that was what happened. Otherwise, he was very slick in his jumping and I'm not worried on that front. He always shows plenty of pace at home. His last piece of work before Cheltenham last season was electric. I know it was a handicap but going there I felt he'd take a lot of beating. They're hard races to fancy horses in but that's the speed he shows. He did very well during the summer and came out early because this race suited him in terms of the conditions. I think there's plenty to work on. He's a second-season hurdler and maybe it'd be throwing him in at the deep end in the Morgiana Hurdle. It's on the agenda, but there might be easier options. The WKD Hurdle at Down Royal could be suitable for him - Willie Mullins, trainer of Saint Roi

quotes.race: David Flynn Building Contractors Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He didn't jump the last day and I said to Paul to have him nicely warmed up before the race. We worked on him since and it must have worked as he jumped very well. We won't aim too high and could look for a rated novice or something like that. He could be a good novice by the time Punchestown comes around and will jump a fence in time - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He didn't become the horse we hoped he would last season. I've asked JP McManus if I can go novice chasing with him, so he'll start off doing that and if it doesn't work out he can revert to hurdles. He's not the biggest but we think he has great scope for jumping. 02-11-21

He was third in the Champion Hurdle behind Honeysuckle last year and this season he has had three runs over fences, winning the Grade 1 over 2m1f at Leopardstown's Christmas meeting. I sent him back there last month for the Dublin Racing Festival but he stumbled and unseated, which was a shame. He could go for the Arkle or the Grand Annual. 08-03-23

runners.name: Stage Star
runners.comment: Won 2m4f Grade 1 novice at Cheltenham; front-runner who is a good jumper; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Took his chase record to 4-5 when seeing off six rivals in the Grade 1 Turners at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) four weeks ago, taking full advantage of being able to dictate the pace; it's possible he'll be able to boss another small field here and his jumping is a real asset; the one to beat.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'd say next year Stage Star will probably be a Ryanair horse. He has got plenty of boot and he travels really well. I'm not sure he needs to go the full Gold Cup distance yet; one day he might. He is a horse we believed in. It didn't go to plan last year, but he has come back this year and that's fantastic. It was a good race and he put it to bed really well. The last run was really good when he carried a big weight here and won very nicely. He was an improving horse but we needed him to take it to the next level. Today was going to test that - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Timeform Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a big weight to carry around there and do that well. I'm thrilled with that. Stage Star is only a novice and he has a bit of experience around here and it means we can come back here in March if we want to in one of the novice chases. He was a Grade 1 winner last season and he is obviously a very nice horse, 142 was a very nice mark if he put it all together. That (the Cheltenham Festival) is a long way off. He would get three miles but it depends on the ground and opposition. He will be well worth running. He is only a novice once - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stage Star is a proper horse and that was a very taking performance. Harry was quite surprised how well he won and said that although he stays, he's got so much speed. He'll be a lovely chaser in time. He'll need a little break after this and I'll talk to the team about the festival. I'm not afraid to wait until Aintree with them. I wouldn't want to go three miles with him so the only race at Cheltenham would be the Ballymore. He coped with that ground, but I always say those good horses cope with any ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Ladbrokes Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stage Star is pretty smart and had some good bumper form, but was always going to improve hurdling. We wanted a couple of runs under his belt before the Challow and he's done everything right, albeit against opposition he should have beaten. We'll find out more about him in the Challow. He's a good-moving horse, but I don't think proper winter ground would bother him - Harry Derham, assistant to trainer Paul Nicholls.

stable_tour.quote: He's almost certain to run in the Turners. He's in the Brown Advisory too and I wouldn't be worried about three miles with him, and if it was dry then we have that race as an option. I thought he was good last time out and I'm already thinking that this time next year we could have a serious horse for the Ryanair. 20-02-23

runners.name: Straw Fan Jack
runners.comment: Smart but 16l behind Saint Roi in Arkle at Cheltenham (2m); back up in trip now
runners.spotlight: Flagbearer for the Sheila Lewis yard who scored twice over hurdles in 2020 and has reached new heights over fences this season; however, his limitations at the highest level were seemingly exposed when 28l fourth in the Arkle at Cheltenham (2m, soft) last time, with the reopposing Saint Roi 16l ahead in third; steps back up in trip now.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Straw Fan Jack has done us proud. He ran in some big handicap hurdles last season, when he probably should have gone chasing, but racing in those big fields has taught him to be a racehorse and wake up. I don't know what we'll do next, but he does want the better ground. Do I think he's Arkle horse? It could be a dream - it probably had crossed my mind but I'm too modest to jinx anything. It's a dream and it would be amazing to have a horse able to run in the Arkle. Sheila Lewis, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Straw Fan Jack has been unbelievable. Richard said there wouldn't be much pace in the race so he knew we'd have to go out and make the running. He's quite lazy and needs other horses alongside him ideally but I knew he'd stay well. He's definitely my star horse, it's great to have one for Saturdays now. I have no plan really of where to go next. Richard suggested the Sandown final which he qualifies for so maybe there - Sheila Lewis, trainer.

runners.name: Visionarian
runners.comment: Chased home Saint Roi in Leopardstown Grade 1 in December; below par back there since
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler and even better chaser, winning first two starts over fences last summer; improved again when second to Saint Roi in a 2m1f Grade 1 at Leopardstown (yielding) in December; not in the same form when a remote sixth to El Fabiolo in another Grade 1 there in February; successful around 2m4f over hurdles; could run well but likely he'll find at least one too strong.

quotes.race: Guinness Open Gate Brewery Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It was very competitive and a lot of them had high marks over hurdles but we always thought our lad would be better over a fence and he's starting to prove that - Peter Fahey, trainer of Visionarian

quotes.race: Island Garden Rooms Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Visionarian is a strong traveller. Stepping him up in trip was a big help to him. We'll put him away now for Galway. The staying handicap hurdle towards the end of the week could suit him well. He's a nice horse going forward and I can't wait to get him over fences. He likes that good ground, too, which is a help. We done his wind since he ran last so that might have helped as well - Peter Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: He done that easily and hurdled very well. The ground was lively enough for him. I was always confident I'd get there. He won like a nice horse - Denis O'Regan, rider

stable_tour.quote: I don't think Fairyhouse was run to suit and he should improve a good bit. I couldn't believe the price he went off at Fairyhouse as he probably needed it a little and he will be aimed at all of those good two-mile handicap hurdles now. W'll have a look at the Dublin Racing Festival and hopefully he might even develop into a County Hurdle horse. He jumps his hurdles a little bit on the big side so we are going to do plenty of schooling with him and try to get him to jump them a little bit lower. He has the makings of being a very nice horse over fences in time. 08-12-21

2:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Bo Zenith
runners.comment: Improving hurdler whose record is 3-4; will be suited by this track; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Beat a notable rival on sole French start; 2-3 in Britain, the wins gained at Haydock (Victor Ludorum) and Stratford (easily) on good to soft; improving hurdler who'll be suited by this track and warrants respect.

quotes.race: Betfred Victor Ludorum Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very nice performance from Bo Zenith. I think they drew a line through his run at Sandown and said he'd come on for it and they were proved right. It's only his third go, he was a little bit green at stages and he'll come on a bundle mentally. The further he went, the better he seemed to go - Tom Cannon, jockey.

runners.name: Chaos Control
runners.comment: Won easily last time but has more on his plate at this level
runners.spotlight: Fair handicapper on Flat; opened his hurdles account with an easy success on good ground at Market Rasen last time; has much more on his plate upped sharply in class.

runners.name: Jipcot
