runners.comment: Ex-French 4yo who needs to improve on his Triumph effort
runners.spotlight: Won well at Pau on last two French runs; shaped better than bare result in the Triumph on British debut but didn't do quite enough to suggest he's going to play a big part in this similar event.

runners.name: Nusret
runners.comment: Has strong form-lines; beat Perseus Way in the Adonis; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Has strong form-lines in Ireland and transferred that to British soil in the Adonis at Kempton (good) where he beat Perseus Way, who was admittedly hindered by imperfect late jumping; has solid claims on the whole.

quotes.race: Coral Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nusret is a lovely horse. I thought his Punchestown win in November was very good. He did a few things wrong that day but still came out on top in a tidy race. The ground was a little bit soft for him on his last two starts and coming back to a sounder surface has definitely helped him. I think right-handed is his preferred angle - Daryl Jacob, rider.

quotes.race: Aquaturf Maiden
quotes.quote: Nusret had been running consistently well and we've been learning about him. The race set up lovely for him and Mikey (Sheehy, rider) gave him a lovely, confident ride. We could look at one of those nice handicaps on Irish Champions Weekend - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I think he'll make a decent juvenile hurdler. He has schooled well, and gained plenty of experience on the Flat. He has a strong middle-distance pedigree. His dam is closely related to Conduit, and he's won over a mile and a half, so there's going to be no worries about stamina. 20-10-22

runners.name: Perseus Way
runners.comment: Might have won the Adonis but for defective late jumps; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Landed the Chatteris Fen at Huntingdon (good to soft) then ran well behind Nusret in the Adonis, which he might have won but for two defective late jumps; not disgraced in the Boodles last time; remains in form.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Chatteris Fen Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Perseus Way is a very nice horse and I'm pleased that he has done it well today. His jumping is getting better all the time, but it needs to. He is getting slicker and quicker and he is starting to enjoy his racing. It was a good run in defeat at Chepstow last time and I felt that Chepstow was probably soft enough for him. We rode him too far back that day and that is why we rode him handier today. I don't think he is good enough to run in the Triumph but I think he could have a strong chance in the handicap - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Dreweatts Handicap
quotes.quote: Perseus Way has not run for months because we've been waiting for the ground. Jim said he'd get as far as you'd want. There is talk Gary Moore could have him for jumping at some stage. We were waiting to see what he'd do today because if he was well beaten, he might have gone to Gary's sooner! We just got away with the trip today as he's a grinder who will appreciate more give in the ground - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very pleased with Perseus Way. I hadn't sat on him at home and it was a proper slog on this ground, but he was quite fit and was able to keep going. He coped with conditions well. He's definitely a nice type for next year, he's big and raw and should furnish away over the winter - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Rightsotom
runners.comment: Possibly flattered by his Triumph effort; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Twice raced; finished second at Fairyhouse in November, then appeared to run well (200-1 sixth) in the Triumph but never threatened and may be flattered by that bare form; others preferred.

runners.name: Sarsons Risk
runners.comment: Won at Doncaster then fell in the Adonis; this is harder
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on Flat for previous yard (ran okay back in that sphere two weeks ago); raced twice over hurdles, winning at Doncaster (good) then leading until falling three out in the Adonis; this is harder.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't exactly the intention to make the running, but Sarsons Risk was fresh from having a wind op and he's schooled very well - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet The UK's Leading Bookmaker Handicap
quotes.quote: The strong pace suited Sarsons Risk and he's a progressive horse. P J McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sarsons Risk had a break, but has a good staying pedigree behind him and connections were optimistic. He was comfortable, although I'm not sure he loved the quick ground. He got away with it and I think he'll improve again going further in trip down the line - David Probert, rider.

runners.name: Scriptwriter

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Disappointing in the Adonis; progressive otherwise; not written off
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in the Adonis; progressive sort otherwise, including two pieces of Grade 2 form (win and clear second; good/soft) at Cheltenham; represents last year's winning yard and may resume his improvement.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The dream is always to come here for the Triumph Hurdle and be coming up the hill similar to how Scriptwriter did here. There's a long time between now and then but he's on the right path. I've believed in this horse since we bought him, especially after the first run (at Sedgefield) where, while he ran green, he showed he could jump. Paddy was extremely positive afterwards - Mark Adams, part-owner.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Scriptwriter went left and went right but he hit the line well. I would say this trip is his minimum - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a 102-rated Flat horse who didn't cost much relative to today's prices. He came from a great yard at Aidan O'Brien's but was probably galloping against very good horses and it was good for him to go to Sedgefield and get his head in front, although he's still green. He'll go for either the Summit Juvenile Hurdle at Doncaster, which we won last year with Knight Salute, or he'll go back to Cheltenham on December 10. I wouldn't want to run him on proper soft ground. Knight Salute won a Grade 1 and you'd be disappointed if this one wasn't a better horse ? he's well bred and has more size and scope, plus a better Flat rating. 20-11-22

We bought him out of Aidan O'Brien's yard having won over a mile. He has run once this season when mid-division in the Ballysax Stakes and, as you can imagine, he has a beautiful pedigree. His schooling has been good, and he should be out in the next three weeks. Very much one to look forward to. 13-10-22

runners.name: Greyval
runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles, including Listed win; promising filly who is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Ex-French filly who is 2-3 since joining Fergal O'Brien and switched to hurdles, the wins gained at Doncaster (Listed) on good ground and Huntingdon (had plenty in hand) on soft; promising sort who is one to consider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Greyval was superb value at 36,000euros and I loved the stamp of her. She wasn't going to be in the Triumph but we popped her in this week, but I doubt she'll go for that. I don't do social runners but we can dream. She's in the Mares' Novice and I half prefer that, but there's a lot of water and bridges - Nick Brown, racing manager of the owners Oakley Partnership.

runners.name: Pawapuri
runners.comment: Held by a couple of these rivals on Adonis running
runners.spotlight: Successful in her last two Flat starts for William Haggas; showed some hurdling promise in the Adonis but is comfortably held by Nusret and Perseus Way on that bare form.

runners.name: Zenta
runners.breeder: E A R L De Cordelles Et Al
runners.comment: Grade 3 win on stable debut; good third in the Triumph; top rated and still improving
runners.spotlight: Listed winner in France then followed up in Fairyhouse Grade 3 on debut for Willie Mullins; subsequently ran well (12-1 third) in a Triumph Hurdle that was dominated by her trainer; top rated and still improving.

4:40.race_name: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Third Time Lucki
runners.comment: Hampered 4th at Cheltenham; can improve further back on less testing finish; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Best on good/good to soft; smart novice chaser last season, including when third in the Grade 1 novice chase at this meeting; below par in November but subsequent wind surgery has helped, winning at Sandown (1m7f, good to soft) and was moving into contention when hampered two out at Cheltenham in March; can find extra back on less testing finish.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Dolos Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki hasn't been right this season but hopefully we have turned a corner. I like the look of the Grand Annual but it depends what the handicapper  does to him. I think Dan would be keener to go to Aintree for the Red Rum on a flat track. One thing the horse has got is speed, he has always been quick and on better ground he would be a better horse - Mike Newbould, owner.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We don't know yet where Third Time Lucki will go next season but he won't be going over two and a half miles. I wish we hadn't bumped the cross fence but he came back on the bridle afterwards and has run well. We've seen the back of Edwardstone in the three times we've been beaten this year - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very happy with Third Time Lucki, he travelled and jumped really well and did nothing wrong. There was a small chance his run two weeks ago would have taken a little bit out of him, but only a little bit, and there's no excuses. Edwardstone won well and he's a very strong Arkle contender. Third Time Lucki didn't underperform and if he did it was by pennies not pounds. We'll keep him in the Arkle but I expect the rain will come sooner rather than later, so the reality is he'll probably go for Aintree - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Off The Fence On attheraces.com Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki had a little bit of an overreach so I'm just going to keep an eye on that. It's nothing bad but we'll see how it is. If he goes to Cheltenham, great. If he has to miss Cheltenham because of the overreach and goes to Aintree then that's fine as well. We're delighted to have him, he's just magic.  He's very, very talented. We slipped into a few mistakes at Sandown but I always said that with that third run in quick succession there was always going to be some apprehension going there. And for a horse like him that wants decent ground you're only 50-50 to get it. We knew when we went there we were stretching the band a bit. He's had a good break and been freshened up. This is the perfect track and perfect trip with a fast-run race, it's all the things we've been craving for him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The November) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry said Third Time Lucki felt fantastic and he feels like a horse with a lot of natural pace. During my apprenticeship with Paul (Nicholls), Ruby Walsh used to talk about the difference between speed and pace and why the latter in a race is so important. It means you can go at your speed very comfortably. He can go through it in second gear, and that's great. He made it a bit harder work, visually, than he did the last day. He was fitter the last day, I just did a lot with him for the first day, he's a very exuberant horse so I pressed him a bit. I didn't want him too fresh and I've done less with him. He's jumped the last and had a bit of a blow. Originally the plan was to come here then the Henry VIII, but whether that'll definitely happen I'll need to talk to Mike (Newbould, owner). I could leave him until Kempton (Wayward Lad) but the ground would have a big bearing - there's no way I'd run him on soft or heavy. He might go there or wait and go to Doncaster (Lightning Novice), then come here. Appreciate It is top of the Arkle market and we've got to see what he does but I want to bring him back for the Arkle. We're going to go down that route and hopefully it'll work out - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always considered Third Time Lucki one of our best horses. I wanted to get some experience into him early, we went to Uttoxeter early then here on bad ground and that unravelled our season. If I had last year back I could've won a big race but the one thing it did do is give him a lot of experience - he's done it all. He's now mature, I've tinkered with his wind and Harry can really ride him. We've been chuffed to bits with his jumping at home and everything has come together.  We might come back here on the Sunday of the Paddy Power meeting, but if the ground was bad he wouldn't run, then he'd go to the Henry VIII. Ultimately he's coming back here in March.  We've got every right to believe in him now and plan for March.  He's a pure two-miler and the faster they go the better - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes £1 Free Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki's last race was a bit of a disaster but today's test suited him a lot better. You can now ride him so much closer to the pace, whereas before we knew he would do too much. He has been relatively busy with four runs already this season, but whilst he is next season's chaser, we still want to compete in top races over hurdles. Everything is under consideration - and I would love to try him in a fast-run handicap - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's always a bit nerve-wracking, especially when you're coming out of bumpers, but luckily with Third Time Lucki it looks like he's got the aptitude for hurdling.  He was a bit keen the whole way round, but they're always going to be keen first time these talented horses because they've not got the fizz out of them. The benefit of having a run will be massively important. I should have thought we'll probably look at the November meeting at Cheltenham - Dan Skelton, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a graduate of Fran and Charlie Poste's and the British point-to-point scene is really on the up. We've always liked him at home and he finds life easy in general. Where we go next I don't know, although Cheltenham is tempting. Whether Third Time Lucki is mentally ready I'm not sure and he'll be a nice horse for the future. We'll weigh up our options - Tom Messenger, assistant to trainer Dan Skelton.

stable_tour.quote: It was an underwhelming comeback in the Haldon Gold Cup but as a second-season chaser you're forced into these races as options are limited. I thought I'd done loads of work with him but in hindsight he probably needed the run a fraction. There's no need to over analyse and we'll go for the Hurst Park at Ascot on Saturday now. His ideal would be two miles on good ground and a flat track, and the obvious race which springs to mind is the Red Rum at Aintree in the spring. 15-11-22

runners.name: Dancing On My Own
runners.comment: Very good 2nd here in 2022; 3lb higher now; may well revive after 2 poor runs in midwinter
runners.spotlight: Wasn't in much form when coming into this race 12 months ago but he ran a stormer from the front to hold on to second place (good to soft; off 3lb lower); two poor efforts in midwinter but a return to more prominent tactics will suit back on more suitable ground; entitled to be involved.

quotes.race: Extra Places Everyday At BetVictor Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Dancing On My Own was a classy novice hurdler and its nice to get him started. He has lots of scope and was clever when he had to be. He got going very easily after the last and hopefully he can progress from here - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider.

quotes.race: Casey Cattle Slats Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's nice to see him come back to the sort of form he showed last year. We checked everything with him after Galway but we just think it didn't suit him - Rachael even said he goes a little to his left. We're delighted he's back on track, he's a lovely horse and it's brilliant to get our first winner for the Mulryans. I think we'll go to Navan over 2m4f towards the end of November [Grade 3 Monksfield Novice Hurdle], we'll stick to left-handed tracks anyway. Obviously we'd love to get him to the Ballymore at Cheltenham next spring. I don't think trip should be a problem. After Christmas last year we ran him in high-quality races with a view to being a novice this year if he didn't win one - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Dancing On My Own

stable_tour.quote: He hadn't run for a long, long time, so it was great to see him winning his beginners' chase so well at Killarney. I was delighted with the way he jumped. The two-mile novice chase at Cheltenham's November meeting has been pencilled into his diary. 24-10-21

runners.name: Dads Lad
runners.comment: Three chase wins in 2022; jumping let him down when finishing remote at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins at up to 2m2f in the second half of 2022 (good to yielding and good ground); has won on soft over hurdles but jumping technique deserted him on that surface when finishing remote back over fences at Cheltenham in March; needs to show the form all wrong just four weeks later.

quotes.race: 888Sport Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a Ruby (Walsh) from Brian (Hayes). We might have to look at the Grand Annual. I thought the ride won it to be honest. Today was the plan, maybe we'll give Dads Lad a short break - Patrick Mullins, representing trainer Willie Mullins.

quotes.race: Bunkers Bar & Restaurant Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Dads Lad was always a very good work horse but was disappointing on the track. He just seems to have got his confidence now and chasing looks to have improved him. Brian (Hayes) gets on brilliant with him. For a cheap horse, he's now won five races in the past year. It's great that he handled the ease in the ground. We might have the option of going back over hurdles for a nice pot off bottom weight. There might be something for him at Listowel. He's very versatile and will have entries everywhere - Patrick Mullins, assistant to Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee On All Irish & UK Races (Q.R.) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ruth Dudfield gets on great with Dads Lad at home. I was afraid they would get swallowed up on the hill but she kept nudging the horse's nose out to keep him in a position. He disappointed me early on but is improving all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He doesn't owe us anything after doing so much already this season. Having won a nice handicap chase at Cheltenham in October, he'll likely head back there again this month. The Greatwood Handicap Hurdle would look a live possibility as he can mix it between hurdles and fences. 07-11-22

runners.name: Pay The Piper
runners.comment: Running well but not the easiest to place in handicaps; current mark will take overcoming
runners.spotlight: Running well all winter and he followed a Musselburgh win (2m, good to soft) with a close call against another in-form rival at Doncaster last month; however, he hasn't been the easiest to place in handicaps over the last two seasons and current mark will take some overcoming.

runners.name: Grey Diamond
runners.breeder: Philippe Ouvry & Ecurie Des Vives Terres
runners.comment: Fifth in 2021 running; improving and impressed at Haydock; up 7lb in better race
runners.spotlight: Ran up to his form at the time when fifth in the 2021 running; lightly raced since but his Sandown run in January (travelling well when coming down two out) promised more and he impressed at Haydock recently (2m, soft) when coming off the bridle only between the last two; on career-high mark in a better race but he went up to a new level last time out.

quotes.race: Haydock Park Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grey Diamond was brilliant early and the pace kind of died. He's got an incredibly high cruising speed and it's about channelling his energy the right way. He likes soft ground - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I sat Grey Diamond just off the pace set by Antunes and it worked out very well - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a real star of a horse for us, but he only ran three times last season as he picked up a niggle after his last run at Wincanton in January, hence he has not been seen since. He is fine now and looks good and strong ahead of his return to action. I am keen to get him out soon to see where we are with him. 09-11-22

runners.name: Before Midnight

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & James & Jean Potter

runners.comment: Smart at 2m last winter but a weak finisher of late; aids no help latest; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Had some smart form at about 2m last winter before finishing a remote sixth in this race; has proved a weak finisher this season, however, and adding tongue-tie and cheekpieces (discarded today) made matters worse at Cheltenham when pulled up on soft; less testing ground will suit but has plenty to prove at present.

quotes.race: Gerard Bertrand Hurst Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fair play to the second, who gave us a good battle, but it shows how genuine Before Midnight is. He did it nicely at Cheltenham and was up 8lb today and had to get stuck in. I think we'll stick to two miles and he didn't show his true colours today. I don't know why. I could probably go out there and say the ground is this or that, but he never jumped like he can. We'll think about the Grand Annual, but we'll probably get a hike and he doesn't owe us anything. He's a good-ground horse - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: 888Sport Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The way Before Midnight jumps is part of why we stepped him back to two miles. It paid off at Chepstow and we felt we had a little bit up our sleeves. This has been the target since May time and it's great to pull it off - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Before Midnight will take a bit more time. He went through the race nicely but when I asked him to put the race to bed he was waiting for a bit. He was holding them, but he was a bit unsure and he'll progress in time. He wants further, but there's no rush. He does everything nicely and has the makings of a nice horse - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Budweiser Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Before Midnight is a horse we like. He handled that ground fine and quickened up well - Nico de Boinville, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a superstar all season and won really well at Cheltenham in October. He also ran an absolute stormer at Doncaster but bumped into a very good horse in Funambule Sivola. He's ultra-consistent, has been in great form and goes there with an each-way chance. 25-02-22

He had a great campaign last season winning four times. He went up in the weights from 129 to 148 and this season he is going to find life considerably tougher. I couldn't be happier with how he has come back from his holidays and how he had been building up to the Byrne Group Chase, in which he finished third a couple of weeks ago. Things will be different to last year when we trained him for the opening Cheltenham meeting. This time we do not have a big target - we are going to find our feet and see where it takes him, particularly off a 19lb higher mark, but he is still capable of winning a big handicap at some stage. 09-11-22

runners.name: Mackenberg
runners.comment: Won first 5 chases; no further progress of late; this test likely to be on the sharp side
runners.spotlight: Won first five chases at distances ranging from 2m to 2m4f but has made no further progress in handicaps this year and, as he hasn't quite got his jumping taped, he's likely to find this test sharper than ideal.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mackenberg is a nice horse, I was very happy with that. But he's still very raw and we won't rush him - Donald McCain, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was an impressive winner on his hurdles debut at Carlisle this month, pulling well clear up the hill. He won his bumper there last season and then got stuck in the mud at Bangor. We'll probably find another hurdle with a penalty and then there's a Listed race at Haydock next month. 09-11-20

He is a horse I have a lot of time for he always gives so much in his races - in fact he has won nine of his 18 starts with a couple of seconds and thirds. Clearly he is useful having won five of his six chases, but he did actually struggle to jump fences when he started, but he has had a lot of practice since and has done tremendously well. His most recent run, when fifth at Doncaster, was far and away the most competitive race he has run in but I think now he is better over 2m4f and on good ground they went very fast last time, although I was very encouraged with how strongly he ran on from the back of the last. He wants soft ground over 2m4f and this talented individual has more improvement to come. 09-02-23

runners.name: Vado Forte

prev_owners.owner: Call It What You Like Syndicate

runners.comment: Best recent form when winning 2m2f chase at Galway in July; looks to have share of weight
runners.spotlight: Best recent form when winning 2m2f chase for Gordon Elliott at Galway in July (soft) but was in the process of running well for these connections when unseating at the last at Thurles in February; probably has his share of weight back in Britain.

quotes.race: Lord Hemphill Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Vado Forte stayed galloping when we let him on early at Limerick and he did something similar today. It worked. He really dug deep too and galloped to the line - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: www.angloprinters.ie Rated Chase
quotes.quote: Vado Forte is a good, fun horse. We thought he'd run well but didn't think he'd do that. I was worried about the trip but I'd say he can come back or go over hurdles too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Robbie Dunne said the going last time was quite holding and we thought this type of ground at Doncaster would be up Vado Forte's street. He's been so consistent and deserved to win a race - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: totepool Sussex Champion Hurdle (A Handicap Hurdle)
quotes.quote: The race was run to suit Vado Forte as they went a good gallop. Josh (Moore, on Early Du Lemo) will be a little bit annoyed with me for what happened on the turn, but there was a gap there and I had plenty of horse so I had to go - Robbie Dunne, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Vado Forte can be very keen but they went such a good gallop today that it played into his hands. He's still got a lot to learn but there's no doubt he's talented. He came back from his bumper at Kempton with a stress fracture to his hind tibia and he'll be even better next year. We won't overrace him this season and ultimately he's a chaser - Tom Lacey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out but then we ran him back too quickly at Down Royal. He's much better than that and we'll find something for him in a few weeks. 15-11-21

runners.name: Global Citizen
runners.comment: Won/3rd in last two runnings of Grand Annual; form chance but others may have more to come
runners.spotlight: Excellent efforts in the last two runnings of the Grand Annual at Cheltenham, winning in 2022 (heavy) and bold show from the front when third last month (soft); form chance on that, he doesn't have to lead and is flexible regarding tracks but others may have more up their sleeves.

quotes.race: Johnny Henderson Grand Annual Challenge Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm chuffed to pieces as I've felt Global Citizen has been on his way back for a while now. It's taken a little time to get his confidence back and the handicapper has been pretty kind to us. Kielan gave him a brilliant ride and he flew up the hill. It's been a hard couple of years for a few reasons, but we're moving to the new yard and this is just the kick we needed. He was a Champion Hurdle horse a few years back and has won some good races, so he has the class - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Had Global Citizen not won today he would probably have gone back to the Champion Hurdle, hence the fact we threw him in at the deep end here. He is good fresh as well, so you might not see him now until the spring - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: The New One Unibet Hurdle (Registered As The Champion Hurdle Trial Hurdle) (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: We'd let Global Citizen roll from the front in his last couple of starts and he was on it too much the whole way. We jumped him off in second rank today and he was good. David said he was a different horse and settled lovely, down the back he was able to ride a race on him rather than just restrain him. His hurdling was incredible again, which is the main key to his success. He has a big future. I kept him in this division because I thought he could be near enough a Champion Hurdle type and today he's proved that he could be. He'll go there with a chance, the track will suit because he stays - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Intermediate Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (Registered As The Gerry Feilden Hurdle) (Listed)
quotes.quote: We missed a week about a week ago with a bang on Global Citizen's joint and we worked him in the week and he worked okay but not with his normal zest, so that was fantastic. He's always a horse I've held in high regard - he's electric at home and I think that's a sign of things to come. Kempton is a track that suits him and we'll have a good go at the Christmas Hurdle next - Ben Pauling, tyrainer.

quotes.race: Myson Radiators Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Div I)
quotes.quote: Global Citizen is a good-moving horse and he'll go hurdling now. We do like him at home and he's growing up all the time - he jumps well at home - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't himself in the Haldon Gold Cup and I suspect it was the different tactics, which didn't work for him at all as he's so flamboyant and enthusiastic. He seems well at home and did a lovely piece of work at Newbury last week, so back over two miles at the top of the handicap in the 0-150 at Newbury this week I think he'll be quite dangerous again. 23-11-20

Last season was our best to date and the highlight was undoubtedly Global Citizen winning the Grand Annual at Cheltenham. He was campaigned over hurdles for his first five races before returning to fences at the festival in March, where he beat Andy Dufresne by three lengths. He showed terrific tenacity on the day and, having hit the front two furlongs out, he repelled all rivals including a strong challenge from the well-backed favourite. I do not see any point in changing things this season and the plan will be to go down a similar route again. We took him to Far Hills in American for the Grand National Hurdle earlier this month, but things did not work out. I will be looking around for some of the smaller Graded hurdle races to try to pick up a bit of prize-money before we head back to Prestbury Park in March. If we can get him there in the same form as at the last festival he hopefully be a big player again. 26-10-22

runners.name: The Last Day
runners.comment: Modest in two starts this winter but 2-2 over C&D, winning this off 2lb lower last year
runners.spotlight: Acts well here, C&D winner in late 2021 and achieved his best result when winning this race 12 months ago (good to soft); an outsider and not a contender in either subsequent start this year but this will have been the target and he is only 2lb higher than last year; considered.

quotes.race: Download The App At Virgin Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Last Day has improved quite a lot physically over the summer and that was a great performance. There's a good handicap at Ascot in a few weeks for him. He's a two-miler who is suited by heavy ground - Evan Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Chase
quotes.quote: The Last Day has done it very nicely and has handled the ground lovely. He's only had a few runs over fences and is learning all the time - Adam Wedge, rider.

quotes.race: Foresters By Steve White Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think the best idea is to put The Last Day out in a field for the rest of the spring and summer as he'll be a lovely horse for the future who is going to jump a fence - Evan Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: University Centre Hartpury "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Last Day has won well but it was probably not a very deep race with the paper favourite not running. He is the type of horse we will be looking after as he is one for the future and will not be rushed - Evan Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This guy is a great advert of what Mr and Mrs Rucker are all about as owners. He always promised to be nice but we had lots of trouble with his legs and he's been put back together on a few occasions. To win a nice prize - the Red Rum at Aintree in April - was brilliant. That's his bag, a fast-run two miles, while the rain came at the right time. When he's right and in good form, he's smart. If we can have a clear run and some rain, he might be a lovely horse for the Haldon Gold Cup as Exeter would suit him down to the ground. 26-10-22

He gave us a day to remember in the spring when winning the Red Rum Handicap Chase at Aintree, which is always one of the most competitive spring handicaps. Everything went right on the day as the rain came and made the ground perfect for The Last Day. Traditionally it's a race that suits the speed horses, but they went off too fast this time and it allowed my fellow to pick them off in the straight. It was a nice race to tick off on the bucket list as it's not an easy one to bag. He hasn't run yet this season but is going well and the plan is to start off back at Sandown this month on the Tolworth card, on the proviso we get plenty of rain. I'd love to take him back to Aintree and try to win the Red Rum again, or the Grand Annual at Cheltenham. But with a horse like him you must take each race as it comes. 05-01-23

runners.name: Hasankey
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Hat-trick at about this trip last midwinter; all too often looked weighted to best since
runners.spotlight: Hat-trick at about this trip last midwinter (on heavy/soft) but in the meantime has all too often looked weighted to his best off similar marks to today's; others higher up the list.

quotes.race: 888Sport Juvenile Hurdle (Northern Lights Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Hasankey walked through the last but battled all the way to the line. This galloping track suited him much better and he'll prefer better ground. He'll probably have a break now and come back in the spring. He was bought off the Flat in Ireland as a dual-purpose horse - Laura Morgan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I've always thought Mastercraftsman's progeny don't want soft going, but after running him on quick ground and getting no joy we let him have a go on heavy around this time last year and he loved it, winning three on the bounce. That run of success resulted in his rating shooting up from 116 to 137 over fences. This season he made a cracking comeback when a head second to Mackenberg at Ayr before finishing mid-division at Cheltenham in November. He's only little but relishes winter conditions and the plan is to go to Lingfield on Friday for the £50,000 2m chase at the Winter Million meeting. He seems in good order and I'm looking forward to seeing him run this week. 18-01-23

runners.name: Defan
runners.comment: Won 2 of 5 completions in handicap chases; better for comeback run; others achieved more
runners.spotlight: Successful in two of his five completions in handicap chases, over 2m1f (on good to yielding and good); well held last July and was entitled to need the run at Limerick 18 days ago but others have clearly achieved more.

quotes.race: Charlie Chute Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Defan's jumping was very good and probably won it for him. He had a nice weight, but considering he's only had a couple of chase runs it was a good test in his first handicap. You'd know by the shape he made over hurdles that he was always going to be a better chaser and thankfully that's the way it's panned out - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good at Listowel when he held off another one of ours, Zarkareva. That was a competitive race and I was delighted for his owner Niall O'Leary, who is from Kerry. That gave him a great thrill. We'll look for something similar for him now. 24-10-21

runners.name: Douglas Talking

prev_owners.owner: The Bristol Boys & Peter J S Russell

runners.comment: Exciting front-runner; impressive at Sandown in March (good to soft); up further 10lb
runners.spotlight: Front-runs; immediate improvement for switch to fences and beaten only twice in seven completions, running flat last May after a long spell of action and back from break in October; had wind surgery since and has looked an exciting prospect this spring, going round Sandown to the manner born in March (1m7f, good to soft); up further 10lb; could yet rate higher.

quotes.race: "Ubique" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Douglas Talking jumps brilliantly. He looks a bit like Ahoy Senor and is by the same sire, which is kind of why we bought him. Maybe he could tell Ahoy Senor about being a bit more balanced at his jumps. He's a different horse over fences. He was keen over hurdles and we spent a lot of time trying to help him settle. He's much happier over fences - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We couldn't get him to jump hurdles properly last season so we put Derek on him over fences and he bolted up on his debut and won three times. He works well and could win a nice two-mile chase this season. He could run at Sandown next. 09-11-22

runners.name: Hatcher
runners.comment: Well treated on form last April; back from poor spell/wind surgery to be good 3rd at Ascot
runners.spotlight: Well treated on best form, 15lb lower than in a Listed handicap at Ayr last April (2m, good to soft) when looking sure to go close until coming down two out; non-completer in next three starts but had wind surgery and last week's third at Ascot (2m1f, good to soft) was promising; can figure.

quotes.race: Mark & Jackie Nixon Ruby Wedding Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hatcher has been a fantastic servant for the yard - we've had him all the way through and he's a yard favourite. He was quite highly strung in his early days but he's grown up a lot over the years and he's quite straightforward now. He doesn't take much training and always tries his heart out on the track. If you had 20 or 30 of him, life would be a lot easier - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Partnership Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hatcher's been a great servant, that's his thirteenth win now. He's a joy to have about. He travelled around so well, they went a good old gallop but he felt in top form today and picked up well - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Toalsbet Casino Novices' Chase
quotes.quote: Hatcher has grown up a lot and he jumped well out there today - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Natural Flake Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hatcher is thriving at present since we changed our tactics and made the running with him. He will have to step up to handicap company at some stage and it will be interesting how he copes. Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Herefordshire & Worcestershire Chamber Of Commerce Intermediate Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Hatcher has still got a bit to learn and will progress from this race as it's not easy to win one of these under a penalty. He's only four and I don't know what the plan will be next so I'll leave that to the trainer - Harry Skelton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I was a bit disappointed with him at Cheltenham on his reappearance but it was the first time he'd been on a track like that and maybe the undulations didn't suit him. He's been a wonderful horse for us already but we need to get him back sparkling, maybe on a flat track, in the better races at Doncaster or Aintree. He wouldn't want the ground too soft. 17-11-20

5:15.race_name: Goffs UK Nickel Coin Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places on National course (GoingStick: Chase 6.0, Hurdle 5.9, National 4.8) (Rail Movements: 1.45 +57yds, 2.20 & 5.15 +51yds, 2.55 +74yds, 3.30 +62yds, 4.05 +16yds and 4.40 +43yds)

runners.name: Alfies Princess
runners.comment: Her Listed second isn't great form but she's open to improvement if settling better
runners.spotlight: Bought for £220,000 after winning Irish mares' point (3m, soft to heavy) last March and went close in Listed mares' bumper on rules debut at Huntingdon (2m, good) in December; that latest form is relatively weak for the grade but she's open to improvement if settling better; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: She's a smashing mare we bought at the Cheltenham sales. She had previously won her only point-to-point and is in a good routine at home doing plenty of work. I would hope we could see her make her rules debut at the end of the month or early December. She has lots of speed and could easily win a bumper but we will wait and see. She has schooled very well at home so I'm very keen to see how she goes on the track. 09-11-22

runners.name: Baby Sage
runners.comment: 9l win on debut at Warwick and her dam was 4th in this race in 2011; could be a contender
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite and won by 9l on debut at Warwick (2m, good) in February; that may have been a modest race but she was impressive and her dam was fourth in this race in 2011; could be a contender.

runners.name: Casa No Mento
runners.comment: Went very close in Listed mares' bumper at Sandown last time and might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point bumper last March (2m, heavy) and easily made it 2-2 in Hereford bumper (2m, soft) in January; went very close in Listed mares' bumper at Sandown (2m, heavy) last time and might not be far away.

runners.name: Dysart Enos
runners.comment: Won Listed mares' bumper at Market Rasen in February and she could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Comfortable win on rules debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) and followed up in Listed mares' bumper at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) in February, beating previous Listed winner Queens Gamble; could be thereabouts.

runners.name: Gaillimh A Run
runners.comment: Has won her last two and respected for Irish trainer who landed this prize in 2018
runners.spotlight: Has improved with each of her four runs and off the mark at Thurles (1m7f, yielding) in December; followed up at Naas (1m7f, soft) last month and she's respected for her Irish trainer, who is selective with his British raiders and won this in 2018; the tongue-tie worn last time is left off.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Gaillimh A Run jumps really well, has done her business now and is rising six so will probably go hurdling. I don't think I'll bother with a winners' bumper - John Queally, trainer

runners.name: Golden Ace
runners.comment: Form of debut win worked out well; only fifth since but failed to settle; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Fifth of 14 at Ascot (1m7f, good to soft) in February, which perhaps highlights her limitations, but it was still a good run under a penalty and she didn't help herself by failing to settle; the form of her debut win at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) worked out well and she's not ruled out.

runners.name: Ici La Reine
runners.comment: 2-2, both on Newcastle AW, and this unbeaten 5yo is a possible player
runners.spotlight: Impressed on debut at Newcastle (2m, AW) in January; only won by a neck there next time but she did well to get up in that steadily run race; should get a proper gallop here and this unbeaten 5yo is a possible player.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 EBF Mares' NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elim') (Cond' & Amateur Jockeys) (GBB) (AW)
quotes.quote: I thought Ici La Reine would run a bit greener than that, but Dylan (Kitts) gave her a lovely ride and he is a brilliant claimer who is a big part of the team. She'll improve markedly on the back of that - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

runners.name: Kay Tara Tara
runners.comment: AW win on debut & good 2nd at Ascot since; further improvement needed in this warm contest
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Lingfield (2m, AW) in December and good second of 14 to Politacus at Ascot (1m7f, good to soft) since; further improvement is possible but necessary if she's to play a part in this warm contest.

runners.name: Lunar Discovery
runners.comment: Won her first two starts and another big run last time; has each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Won last year on her first two starts (2m, good to soft/heavy) and ran another big race when second past the post under a double penalty at Ayr in February (2m, good to soft; disqualified - rider breached whip rules); goes up in grade but she has each-way possibilities.

runners.name: Magic Dawn
runners.comment: Sold for £185,000 after Punchestown win; no surprise if she has a part to play
runners.spotlight: Left her December debut (2m, good to yielding) well behind when winning at Punchestown (2m2f, soft to heavy) on New Year's Eve, the front two clear; subsequently sold out of Michael Hickey's yard for £185,000; has joined a top Irish stable and it will be no surprise if she has a part to play.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Magic Dawn has a great pedigree. That's three runners out of the mare now and three winners. She quickened up well in the straight. She's a fine big mare and I'm glad I didn't sell her. She was only making 12,000 at the sales and will make a nice broodmare - Michael Hickey, trainer.

runners.name: Notkeepinyagoing
runners.comment: Bolted up on bumper debut last September and runner-up went one better next time
runners.spotlight: Won Irish mares' maiden point (3m, soft) last April on her third start and bolted up on bumper debut at Galway (2m, yielding) last September; the runner-up went one better next time and she's firmly in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: We were going to run her in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham last weekend but just didn't feel she was 100 per cent, though she had previously been working really well. She should be able to get black type in a bumper and we'll go hurdling then. I think she'll go on any ground. 21-11-22

As things have grown in recent seasons, we've been very lucky in that our owners have been stocking up with some lovely young horses, like Notkeepinyagoing. She was sent to us after winning her point-to-point at Oldcastle 12 months ago. She's had one run for us, when landing a Galway mares' bumper by 13 lengths from Presenting J, who won next time out. Notkeepinyagoing hasn't run since due to a small issue which cost us some time but she's working well again and the plan is to go for the mares' bumper at Aintree or, failing that, Punchestown. That'll be her final bumper as I intend to go hurdling with her this summer, when I hope she can prove my opinion of her correct and get some black type. She handles good ground best, so we'll try and make hay in the summer and give her a break when the ground goes soft in the winter months. 06-04-23

runners.name: Politacus
runners.comment: Won at Ascot on her fourth start but others have stronger form
runners.spotlight: Went very close at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) in December on her third start then beat a couple of these (who were carrying penalties) to win at Ascot (1m7f, good to soft); however, others have stronger form.

quotes.race: British European Breeders' Fund EBF Mares' Open NH Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Politacus is a nice mare and based on that performance today I should've definitely won on her last time. The ground and the track really suited her, she really dug in and did that well - Liam Harrison, jockey.

runners.name: Rockstown Girl
runners.comment: Third of seven in Leopardstown Grade 2 latest; limitations may once more be exposed here
runners.spotlight: Won on her debut at Roscommon  (1m7f, good) last July and some creditable efforts in defeat since, most recently a 10l third of seven in a mares' Grade 2 at Leopardstown (2m, yielding) in February; however, her limitations may once more be exposed here.

runners.name: Saint Bibiana
runners.comment: Narrow win at Uttoxeter in December on fourth start; needs something extra to win this
runners.spotlight: Narrowly beat Politacus (who won at Ascot next time) to get off the mark at the fourth attempt at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) in December; jinked right, hit false rail and unseated rider at halfway in Sandown Listed race since; her form has to go to the next level if she's to win this.

runners.name: Seeyouinmydreams
runners.comment: Easily made all on bumper debut at Newbury and she's an exciting prospect for top yard
runners.spotlight: Easy win on debut in Irish mares' maiden point (3m, good) and, following 235,000gns sale, same story when making all at Newbury (2m, good) last month; she could do with settling better now against classier opposition, but she's an exciting prospect for her top yard; could play a leading role.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Store Sales With ITM Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Seeyouinmydreams is a fair horse and she'll go to Aintree now for the mares' bumper there. Harry had never sat on her, but said he thought she'd win going to the start because she felt so good. We haven't pushed many buttons and we thought she was nice, but you never know until you run them. She's already won a point-to-point, so will be a lovely hurdler next season after a summer of strengthening - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely prospect and I've been delighted with her, but we're in it for the long game with fillies like her and I'm in no rush. She was very impressive when hacking up by 15 lengths in a Irish mares' maiden point-to-point at Largy in April, after which she was bought at the Tattersalls May NH Sale. She didn't come cheap but all the right faces were trying to buy her. She's from a great family, being related to three winners, notably the smart hurdler Songe. Two or three runs in bumpers will suffice for this season, but without doubt she's a name to remember for the future. 31-10-22

runners.name: Shes A Fine Wine
runners.comment: Easy win at Southwell last month and remains to be seen where ceiling of her ability lies
runners.spotlight: Built upon the promise of February's debut at Ayr (2m, good to soft) with easy win at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month; this is much tougher but it remains to be seen where the ceiling of her ability lies.

runners.name: Telepathique
runners.comment: Won at Warwick in February but others have greater substance to their form
runners.spotlight: Encouraging fourth on debut at Wetherby (2m, good to soft) in February and improved to win at Warwick (2m, good) later that month; could continue to progress but others have greater substance to their form.

runners.name: Williamstowndancer
runners.comment: From top Irish yard and could have more to offer, but a sizeable step forward is needed
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Punchestown (2m, good) last October and perhaps the soft ground wasn't ideal when an unplaced favourite in a Listed mares' race at Navan in November, when last seen; represents top Irish stable and she could have more to offer, but a sizeable step forward is needed.

runners.name: Jolie Coeur Allen
runners.comment: Considerable promise on sole French start and has joined top connections
runners.spotlight: Endured a long wait for a gap before finishing strongly for second on debut in French 3yo fillies' bumper (1m5f, good to soft) last September; that form has been franked and she's a half-sister to her top connections' Grade 3 hurdle winner Icare Allen, who also had just the one start for Anne-Sophie Pacault before changing hands; very interesting contender.

runners.name: July Flower
runners.owner: C B Woods & Mr N Doolin
runners.comment: 2-2 in France (including 3yo Grade 1) and brings considerable potential to stable debut
runners.spotlight: Readily won French bumper (1m6f, good to soft) on debut last October and followed up in 3yo Grade 1 (1m5f, very soft) in November; has since joined a top Irish yard and brings considerable potential to her stable debut.

4:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Jatiluwih
runners.breeder: G Cherel, Mme I Pacault et al
runners.comment: Handicapper on top this winter and others come here with stronger claims
runners.spotlight: No win under rules since November 2019 and he's still only 4lb lower than for that Cheltenham success; ran okay over 3m2f at Warwick last month but others are more persuasive today; stable also runs Stellar Magic.

quotes.race: Motor Auction Group Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jatiluwih jinked at a puddle on the way down and I went out the side door. He's a really nice horse and he did well to give that weight to some nice horses - David Maxwell, rider.

quotes.race: Shropshire Homes Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jatiluwih was found for me in France by Guy Petit, who assured me  he was a nice horse even though his form over there is nothing to write home about, The horse gave me a great feel and has won well so that is a good omen for his future - David Maxwell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's quite a nice horse and I expect he'll go back hunter chasing at some point. We'll be looking at handicaps before then. 25-10-21

runners.name: Stellar Magic
runners.comment: Dual course winner; retains ability and one to note back down in class
runners.spotlight: Ran well for second at Wincanton on Boxing Day (3m, good to soft) and he wasn't far off that level when fourth at Uttoxeter four weeks ago; this is a shade easier; not ruled out back at the scene of his two rules wins.

stable_tour.quote: He'll run today, he had some decent form last season without winning and looked as the season went on that going further would help. The soft ground is definitely what he needs. 08-11-22

runners.name: Copper Coin
runners.comment: Retains ability & this represents an ease in grade; conditions fine; has a good run in him
runners.spotlight: Won three times in 2021 and today's conditions shouldn't faze him; has retained ability in his light campaign this season, not seeing things out having travelled strongly at Newbury when last seen in November; one to take seriously back down in grade.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Copper Coin has done well to win over fences, he wouldn't be the most natural. Running over fences made a bit more of a man of him, he was a little bit awkward over hurdles before that, he'd hang a bit. He was a lot better today - Tom Scudamore, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He is a winner over hurdles as well as fences but we have been campaigning him over the former last season and I was very happy with his first run of the new campaign when second at Uttoxeter. He has come out of that well and I am looking at Market Rasen this Thursday for his next run, where I would hope he will be very competitive. I could see him reverting to fences later this season when we get some better ground, which is very important to him. He could be a nice three-mile chaser in the spring. 21-11-22

runners.name: Jet Of Magic
runners.comment: Early unseat latest but on the up beforehand, including over C&D; place claims at least
runners.spotlight: Hereford winner in November before a narrow defeat over C&D nine days later; solid efforts on next two starts before an early unseat at Wincanton in February; more appealing than many; yard also runs Take Your Time.

quotes.race: Hereford Racecourse Ownership Club Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good first run for us, we'll have a bit of fun with Jet Of Magic. He didn't come in until August 1 which is about three weeks late and I felt he'd probably improve a little for the run. He's a good fun horse and he'll jump a fence soon where we'll find out a bit more about him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was third in a good race the other day at Sandown and unseated early on at Wincanton last time. He wouldn't want the ground to be too soft, but he's a possible for the Pertemps. 20-02-23

runners.name: American Sniper
runners.comment: Failed to fire latest but progressing beforehand; stamina has to be taken on trust
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 2m in November, once here; underperformer behind Hititi at Exeter last month when the race reportedly came too soon after his Newbury second (2m4f, good) one week earlier; now tackles 3m for the first time under rules (promise at the trip in a point).

stable_tour.quote: He showed a lot of promise in his two bumpers, finishing second on each occasion. He was more successful over hurdles, winning back-to-back novices at Chepstow and Taunton in November. He has run well without winning since but found the easing ground after those successes to be against him. He will be out when we get better going underfoot and I think there is more to come. He is in good order presently and I am looking forward to getting him out again. 22-02-23

runners.name: Sayadam
runners.comment: Won 4 of his 8 starts; yard in better form now than when last seen; 3m may help too
runners.spotlight: The winner of four of his eight starts, most recently over 2m3f on soft ground in November; not progressed since but his stable is in better form now and the step up to 3m also offers hope of better; one to take seriously.

stable_tour.quote: He's unbelievably tough and ran a cracking race at Fontwell last time. We were planning to go over fences with him but have decided to stay over hurdles. He's tough and honest, and I think he'll get further. There should be a decent race in him. 21-11-22

runners.name: Hititi
runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick and 3m around here should be in range; obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Chasing a hat-trick after comfortable wins at Exeter and Wincanton last month; untested at 3m but stayed an extended 2m5f at stiffer Exeter well enough; doubt he's handicapped out of things just yet.

runners.name: Brazos
runners.comment: Yet to shine in two runs for current stable; easy enough to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Flat (useful)/hurdle winner in Ireland; pulled up behind Hititi at Exeter on his stable debut and tailed off on heavy ground here when switched to fences two weeks ago; too much to prove for now.

quotes.race: Graigs Lane Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Brazos is good and honest. He loves it around here and won the Cesarewitch at this track. He moved real well today and jumped well. Hopefully he'll have a nice novice campaign for the rest of the season - Kevin Brouder, rider

quotes.race: Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Brazos relished the trip and the ground. He worked like a good horse the other morning and I am glad he showed it out there. He is not one it ingenuine, the blinkers are only on him because he idles. I had a lovely trip around. Sometimes there can he hassle in these big-field handicaps but everything was smooth here - Shane Foley, winning rider

quotes.race: K.W.D. Kingdom Gold Cup Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Derek O'Connor rode him at Galway the last day and said he was on and off it and the blinkers helped him travel today. He stays very well, is ground-versatile and could run in the Irish Cesarewitch now - George Murphy, assistant to trainer John Joe Murphy

quotes.race: MAC Fuels & General Supplies Maiden
quotes.quote: He ran well at Tipperary and we felt he had improved from that start based on what he'd shown us at home. We were worried about the ground - George Murphy, assistant and son of trainer, John

runners.name: Take Your Time
runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs this season; good mark if change of headgear revives his fortunes
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs this season having undergone wind surgery one year ago; quickly dropped 8lb as a result but connections now switch to blinkers in a bid to revive his fortunes.

quotes.race: Chris Young Memorial "National Hunt" EBF Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's progressed again. Take Your Time was a bit babyish last time but put it together really well and has great stamina. I asked him a lot three out but he got back into his stride and fought off everyone - Bryony Frost, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent, fun horse who started last season on a fair mark and won staying handicap hurdles at Ffos Las in October and Chepstow in December, demonstrating stamina in abundance. He's always at his best in the autumn and his form went downhill after. He's since had a wind operation and I hope this will help him to bounce back as he approaches his favourite time of the year. He's taking his time to get fit but should be out in a novice chase later in November. 31-10-22

3:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Milanford
runners.comment: Long time since anywhere near best; hard to have faith in revival but he drops in grade
runners.spotlight: Long time since he showed anything approximating his best form and he dropped right out at Newbury 20 days ago; hard to have much faith in a revival but at least he's in a lower grade today; cheekpieces are refitted.

runners.name: Furkash
runners.comment: Sole win in late 2020; ups and downs since; not repeated good 2nd over 2m7f in January
runners.spotlight: Sole win in a novice hurdle in late 2020; had ups and downs since and although he did better when runner-up over 2m7f at Huntingdon in January (good to soft) he's been on the back foot in two subsequent runs.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky at Stratford last week. His record over fences doesn't look that great but he's a super jumper and it was just silly mistake late on. I think he'd have been in the first two had he got round and we'll keep him over fences. 31-10-22

runners.name: Cobra Commander
runners.comment: Finished remote in both starts in the autumn and pulled up at Hereford in February
runners.spotlight: Ended latest campaign with two staying wins, in this race and at Newton Abbot (both on good) but he finished remote in both starts in the autumn and bled from the nose when pulled up at Hereford in February; looks risky after that.

runners.name: Mexican Boy
runners.comment: Hasn't gone on over fences but he's not ruled out in a weak race
runners.spotlight: Hasn't gone on over fences since finishing close up on chase debut in 2m handicap at Southwell in November, and he fell at Wetherby less than two weeks ago (minus aids, as today); however, he's not ruled out in a weak race.

runners.name: Ofaolains Lad
runners.comment: Won two in a row in autumn 2021 but has been absent since
runners.spotlight: Ended most recent campaign in very good form with wins at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good) and Wincanton (3m1f, good to firm) but the latter win was in October 2021 and a lot to take on trust now having first run since.

runners.name: Bal Amie
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in 2 staying h'cap chases for new yard, most recently tailed off in October
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins in Jersey but has been soundly beaten in two staying handicap chases for new yard, most recently tailed off in October; is one to watch back from a break.

runners.name: Advantura
runners.comment: Return to this track offers hope but he has a confidence query for now
runners.spotlight: Good efforts in both course starts, over hurdles and fences, going close over 3m2f here in December (good to soft) but fell either side of that and was pulled up at Chepstow last month; return to this track offers hope but has a confidence query for now.

runners.name: Botus Fleming
runners.comment: Heavy defeats in two staying handicap chases here in December; has had wind surgery since
runners.spotlight: Minor form so far and suffered heavy defeats in two staying handicap chases here in December; has had wind surgery since; good deal to find.

2:35.race_name: Pony Racing Pathway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Aurigny Mill
runners.comment: Improved to win over C&D last month on fifth start; solid claims if repeating that promise
runners.spotlight: Improved form when winning over C&D (good to soft) last month on his fifth start, when his trainer reported he had recently overcome foot problems; solid claims under a penalty if repeating that promise.

runners.name: Iliko Dolivate
runners.comment: Very disappointing at Newbury three weeks ago but a key player judged on earlier promise
runners.spotlight: Very disappointing at Newbury three weeks ago; however, that was too bad to be true and he's a key player for his top yard judged on his earlier promise (on various ground), including a win here in January.

quotes.race: Broadway & Horton Cricket Club Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Iliko D'Olivate is a very nice horse, he was backwards and has only just turned five. We've been patient with him and he was ready to run. We'll find some novice hurdles for him and ultimately he'll make a lovely chaser - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, strong, backward individual and we're not rushing him. Being beaten a whisker on his only run in France in a four-year-old conditions hurdle at Compiegne at the end of March was the best thing that could have happened as he's a maiden for this season. The winner, Irish Bar, hasn't so far franked the form, although the highly rated fifth dotted up next time. He should be ready towards the end of November. 31-10-22

runners.name: Mardoof
runners.comment: Built on previous promise for easy win over C&D last month and he's a leading candidate
runners.spotlight: Placed three times in a row this winter and built on those efforts with an easy win over C&D (good to soft) last month; leading candidate under a penalty if performing to a similar level today.

runners.name: Boolamore Glory
runners.comment: Well beaten in February 2022 on first two hurdle starts and absent since
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish maiden point (3m, good) in 2021 but well beaten in February 2022 on first two hurdle starts and absent since.

runners.name: Emanate
runners.comment: Very modest maiden on the Flat; makes hurdle debut after an absence
runners.spotlight: Very modest maiden on the Flat and needs to improve dramatically for the switch to hurdles on this first start since last June.

runners.name: Dark Moon
runners.comment: 66-1, down the field in both bumpers; now goes hurdling
runners.spotlight: 66-1, down the field in both bumpers; now goes hurdling.

runners.name: Tango For Sally
runners.comment: 50-1, tailed off on debut in Wincanton bumper (1m7f, good to firm) last November
runners.spotlight: 50-1, tailed off on debut in Wincanton bumper (1m7f, good to firm) last November; transformation needed in first-time hood on hurdle debut.

runners.name: Beautiful Surprise
runners.owner: Samuel Quigley & Thorne Farm Racing Ltd

runners.name: By Pass
runners.comment: Fair 3rd at Hereford in February but form either side of that hasn't been at same standard
runners.spotlight: Fairly encouraging third at Hereford (2m, good) in February but her form either side of that hasn't been at the same standard; others preferred.

3:10.race_name: Brain Tumour Research Novices' Handicap Hurdle
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Looking For Larry
runners.comment: Dead-heated on 2m Exeter handicap debut; much longer trip now but did win a 3m point
runners.spotlight: Left his qualifying runs over hurdles behind when staying on well to force a dead heat on 2m Exeter handicap debut (good) five weeks ago; tackles a significantly longer trip now but this 3m point winner looks sure to stay a lot further; likely capable of better again.

runners.name: Nickelsonthedime

prev_owners.owner: A Graham - Bankruptcy Trustee M Stanley

runners.comment: Below-form fourth latest but is nicely treated if reacting well to new headgear (blinkers)
runners.spotlight: Never looked like justifying favouritism (off bridle from early stage) when fourth at Warwick (3m2f, good) seven weeks ago but has dropped to 1lb below the mark he won off last spring and it's possible new headgear (first-time blinkers for cheekpieces) could put an edge on him; not dismissed.

runners.name: Picks Lad
runners.comment: Bumper winner; promise in qualifying runs over hurdles and likely improver in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won an Ayr bumper for Micky Hammond last spring; has fair form in 2m novice hurdles for this yard since; there's plenty of stamina in his pedigree and he appeals as one who could go on to better things now handicapping over a much longer trip; interesting runner.

runners.name: Champ Royal
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles in Ireland for Colm Murphy; betting should guide on yard debut
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles in Ireland for Colm Murphy, not really going on from his handicap debut third at Navan (2m5f, heavy) early last year; steps back up in trip for stable debut after 87 days off; betting perhaps the best guide to expectations.

runners.name: Getupearly
runners.comment: Second on handicap debut but has disappointed twice since; hard to know what to expect
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; made an encouraging handicap debut when second at Hereford (3m1f, good) in early February but has disappointed twice since; player on the Hereford form but it's hard to be confident.

stable_tour.quote: He was third at Worcester on his first race for us and I was very happy with that. I think he'll improve for the run, it was soft at the track which suited him well and he'll probably want three miles soon. 08-11-22

runners.name: Pedley Wood
runners.comment: Placed in both handicaps but needs more for the win; steps up in trip now
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who lost out only by a short head after leader fell at final flight on handicap debut at Hereford (2m5f, good) in February; beaten 13l when a no more than respectable third at Exeter (2m2f, good to soft) last month; needs this new trip to unlock some improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He won an English point-to-point and looks a nice horse. He jumps well, wants a bit of dig in the ground and should be ready to run in the middle of November. He'll go novice hurdling. 31-10-22

runners.name: Dancingontheedge
runners.comment: May have won over C&D latest but for two late mistakes; high on shortlist for top yard
runners.spotlight: Best hurdle run when second in a C&D handicap (good to soft) a month ago, going down by only a neck despite fluffing the final two flights; raised 5lb but she is unexposed at this trip and there's a race in her if she can cut out the errors.

quotes.race: Follow @AtTheRaces On Twitter Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect her to do that. I ride Dancingontheedge at home, she was very calm and quiet in the paddock but as soon as she got out onto the track she surprised me. We went a decent gallop and the way she went about it was pleasing - Harry Cobden, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, fine daughter of Kapgarde and I love the sire's stock, for no particular reason other than he gets some smashing individuals who get better as they get older, and I've been lucky with them. When that happens you tend to buy more of them. This mare had been no morning glory at home - early on she had so much trouble getting up our hill that one day we virtually had to get off and push her - so I was surprised when she made a winning debut in a bumper at Worcester in April. She ran a bit fresh and free at Chepstow on her hurdling debut this month and needs a couple of runs for educational experience, so I suspect we'll see her at her best handicapping in the spring. 31-10-22

runners.name: Sandalwood
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras D'Enki
runners.comment: In top hands but stopped quickly when last of five on Wincanton handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Yet to match his bumper form over hurdles, sent off favourite for 2m5f Wincanton handicap last time but stopped quickly to finish last of five; much too soon to write off given who trains him but has a bit to prove this time.

stable_tour.quote: A big, backward horse who has needed plenty of time, he had three bumper runs last season, his best effort coming on the final one when second at Newton Abbot. He'll go novice hurdling over a trip, anytime now, and will benefit from cut in the ground. There's more to come from him. 31-10-22

runners.name: Safe Destination
runners.comment: Yet to make significant impact, including in handicaps; others more persuasive
runners.spotlight: Yet to make a significant impact, including in handicaps at up to 3m on last three starts; others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Mojito Royale
runners.comment: Placed in novice hurdles in 2021 but struggled in light handicap career since
runners.spotlight: Placed in two 2m3f Hereford novice hurdles (both on good) in late 2021 but has struggled in a light handicap career since, pulling up on both outings this term.

runners.name: Country Kitten
runners.comment: Sprung 40-1 surprise at Market Rasen latest but no fluke about it; respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete over fences in first two handicaps but different proposition back hurdling at Market Rasen (2m7f, soft) last month; only had 4l to spare at the line but impressed with the way she quickened around twice that margin clear going to the second last, suggesting there could be more in the locker; respected.

runners.name: Weavers Answer
runners.comment: Has made frame in all three handicaps at up to 2m3f but stamina to prove up in trip
runners.spotlight: Second on handicap debut at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in December but a bit below that level when fourth at Ludlow (2m, good) and Chepstow (2m3f, soft); faded from the final final flight at the last-named course so this significant step up in trip isn't an obvious move.

runners.name: Div Ine Tara
runners.breeder: Mrs K Exall & Mr A Exall
runners.comment: In good hands but beaten 22l when fourth on handicap debut; others more obvious
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a couple of bumpers in the summer of 2021 but has been unable to build on that in four starts over hurdles, including beaten 22l into fourth on 2m4f Southwell handicap debut 24 days ago; up in trip now; early days but others arrive with more pressing claims.

runners.name: Imprevu Du Large
runners.comment: Interesting now handicapping at low level for top yard, particularly if backed
runners.spotlight: Beaten upwards of 42l in three qualifying runs at up to 2m5f (good/good to soft) this year but it's very rare for his top trainer to get one in off such a low opening mark; one of three runners from the stable and it'll be very interesting to see how he goes in the betting.

4:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Man Of The Sea
runners.comment: Productive sort but absent since November and may need this first run back
runners.spotlight: Suited by good/firmer; had a productive spell (Flat/hurdles) in Jersey prior to scoring at Stratford on his return to the mainland; absent since a defeat in November, however, and may need this first run back.

quotes.race: NB Surfacing Handicap
quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea won well. Mr Mulholland said before the race he was in great form. He was a bit outpaced the last day at Windsor but he stays all day. He pinged the gates, I kept hold of him and he ran all the way to the line - George Rooke, rider.

quotes.race: Come Racing 11th November Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea jumped and travelled, I was able to sit off the good pace and when I got stuck into him he saw it out to the line. He has plenty of experience and it stood to him. He did it well and hopefully there's another day in him - Billy Lee, rider

runners.name: Forever Des Long
runners.comment: Poor form for current yard; first-time tongue-tie needs to prompt a revival
runners.spotlight: Defied a higher mark when with previous stable; holds poor claims on form for current yard, however, and first-time tongue-tie needs to prompt a major turnaround.

stable_tour.quote: He's been unlucky. He keeps on finishing second but I don't think there's anything wrong with the horse. He's genuine but just unlucky, being placed five times from nine runs. He'll probably want further than two miles and he'll be running before too long. We'll start over hurdles but he could go chasing. 25-10-21

runners.name: Robinsville
runners.comment: Nicely bred 6yo who looks open to improvement now qualified for handicaps; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Absent since a heavy defeat in maiden hurdle at Cheltenham on New Year's Day; penultimate effort was mildly promising; nicely bred 6yo who looks open to improvement now qualified for handicaps; shortlisted.

runners.name: Noble Savage
runners.comment: First past the post at Wincanton last month; poor effort subsequently
runners.spotlight: Finished first past the post (demoted to second) in 2m5f event at Wincanton last month; failed to back up that form over the same C&D later in March; has form at 2m but latest effort tempers enthusiasm.

runners.name: Gavin
runners.comment: On a workable mark but absent since a poor effort in October
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in 2021; has slipped to a workable mark but lacks recent match practice having been absent since a poor effort in October; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Ho Que Oui

prev_owners.owner: Alex Fierz, H De Lageneste Et Al
