runners.comment: Something to prove back down in trip and returned to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Hurdle scorer in France; clear best form in Britain when scoring over fences (2m5f) in October; absent since December; has something to prove back down in trip and returned to this sphere.

runners.name: Faerie Cutlass
runners.comment: Out of a winning hurdler for her connections; likely improver on h'cap debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Just minor form in novice hurdles at this course; however, she's bred to do better still (out of a dual hurdles winner for her connections) and looks a likely improver now handicapping off 90; very interesting.

runners.name: Phoenix Risen
runners.comment: Ran well in first-time cheekpieces here six weeks ago; possibilities in retained headgear
runners.spotlight: Ran well in first-time cheekpieces here (2m3f, good) six weeks ago, achieving his first piece of placed form; may well take another step forward with the headgear retained; possibilities off same mark.

runners.name: Secret Potion
runners.comment: Drop back to 2m looks ideal; on a handy mark; not without a chance
runners.spotlight: Seemed a non-stayer over 2m3f here last month when having first hurdles start since 2021 (raced on Flat in the interim); defied a 5lb higher mark over 2m two years ago; not without a chance.

runners.name: Sassified
runners.comment: Interesting with cheekpieces reapplied (Irish Flat win came in this headgear)
runners.spotlight: Down the field in 2m3f contest here two months ago when making handicap hurdle debut; however, looks interesting with cheekpieces applied for first time under this code (Irish Flat win came in this headgear).

runners.name: Syr Maffos
runners.comment: May improve back on better ground; blinkers replace visor worn last time
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; shaped better than bare result in first-time visor at Uttoxeter when last seen, eventually tiring on the heavy going; may improve back on better ground with blinkers now given a whirl.

runners.name: Nordy Lordy
runners.comment: Point bumper winner; poor results under rules but may do better now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Point bumper winner; poor results under rules and has pulled hard on occasions; however, he's in good hands and may be capable of better now handicapping off just 79.

runners.name: Tuscan Rose
runners.comment: Bred to do better still; possible improver on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Distant fifth on latest outing and still has poor form; however, bred to do better still (related to two winners for her stable) and may be capable of a bigger effort now handicapping off only 78.

runners.name: Gorcombe Moonshine
runners.comment: Holds each-way hopes having been placed in two of his last four runs
runners.spotlight: Starting to look exposed as a modest maiden but holds each-way hopes having been placed in two of his last four appearances; respectable third at Exeter (2m, good) latest.

runners.name: Presgrave

prev_owners.owner: M Watson, C Coward And J D Frost

runners.comment: Ran well here in November; place claims if back to that form
runners.spotlight: Finished behind fellow maiden Gorcombe Moonshine at Exeter most recently but ran well (40-1 third) over 2m3f here in November and has place claims if back to that form.

runners.name: Ghyll Manor
runners.comment: Handicap debutant who has very weak claims on form
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant who has very weak claims on his form shown in juvenile hurdles; jumping lacked fluency here when last seen; 4lb out of the weights; needs a transformation.

runners.name: La Referi
runners.comment: Has nothing to recommend her; 17lb out of weights on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdler who has nothing to recommend her; beaten long way here the last twice; 17lb out of the weights on handicap debut.

2:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Bob And Co
runners.comment: Useful on his day; leading player back down in class on second run for new trainer
runners.spotlight: Useful hunter chaser, winning five times, when trained at Ditcheat; stayed on for eighth in the big one at Cheltenham last month when back from one-year absence and making debut for Paul Nicholls' former assistant Harry Derham; holds leading claims back down in class.

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star Champion Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: That was amazing. Bob And Co deserved to win because he wanted it badly and he was never going to lie down - David Maxwell, rider and owner.

stable_tour.quote: The ground wasn't right for him at Haydock on Saturday, but he ran a lovely race and that'll put him spot-on for Cheltenham. The better pace and the better spring ground at Cheltenham is what he wants, and he will come on for the race as I've trained him to peak at the festival. The Hunters' Chase is a race I like and a race we've done well in recently, too. David [Maxwell] loves riding his own horses and couldn't do it last year, so it'll be lovely for him to get that chance this year. Hopefully with a clear round he'll run well. 20-02-22

runners.name: Let Me Entertain U
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D & T Futter & Mr B Keogh
runners.comment: Chase debutant; much younger than his rivals but faces a stiff task on ratings
runners.spotlight: Bumper/point winner who is 0-12 over hurdles; much younger than his two rivals and may be capable of improvement now switched to chasing but faces a stiff task on ratings; usual headgear removed.

runners.name: Sir Ivan
runners.comment: Makes hunter chase debut aged 13; main threat to Bob And Co on form
runners.spotlight: Good handicap chaser on his day; campaigned mostly in veterans' events since late 2020; has left it very late to go hunter chasing (now a 13yo) but starts off in a weak race and is the main threat to Bob And Co.

quotes.race: BetVictor Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 3 Of The Veterans' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: Sir Ivan has been really consistent and Lorcan gets a great tune out of him. I had him in over hurdles at Wincanton recently, but I got there and the ground was bottomless so I thought we'd wait for this and I'm delighted for the horse. He'll be kept in training and I imagine we'll aim for the final of the veterans' series at Sandown again next January - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys General Stud Book Online Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Sir Ivan made a couple of mistakes, but he's not a bad jumper. It's just that sometimes he loses concentration - Noel Fehily, jockey

quotes.race: Huge Cheltenham Offer At 32RedSport.com "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sir Ivan has been a work in progress as he didn't really go the right way in bumpers. He doesn't want the ground much quicker than this so we will have to pick and choose where he runs next under a penalty - Harry Fry, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been third in the last two veterans' chase finals at Sandown and that will be his aim again. He'll hopefully run at the end of November in one of the veterans' races at either Leicester or Haydock. 11-11-22

The old boy, who has six wins to his name, made a cracking comeback this season when third to Dingo Dollar at Aintree and then filled the same place at Fontwell last week. That was his prep run for his main target of the season, the Veterans' Handicap Chase Final at Sandown, in which he has finished third in each of the past two runnings. His consistency has made it hard for the handicapper to relent but Lorcan Murtagh seems to get on very well with him and will be aboard again next month, when you can bet he'll be a big player again. 14-12-22

5:25.race_name: Evening Meeting Thursday 27th April Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 3 Elimination) (GBB)
5:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.6)

runners.name: Hi Trig
runners.comment: Newcomer; trainer 0-16 in bumpers in last five years
runners.spotlight: Home-bred half-brother to a winning hurdler; trainer 0-16 in bumpers in last five seasons; others more obvious than this newcomer.

runners.name: Idamix
runners.breeder: Mrs Benedicte Charoy & Mr Feycal Zabat
runners.comment: Newcomer; half-brother to two French winners; trainer has good record in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Cost 40,000euros as a 3yo; half-brother to two French chasing winners (one also won a bumper); trainer has very respectable 17% strike-rate in these races; certainly worth a second look.

runners.name: Il Va De Soi
runners.comment: Just beaten at Kempton in February and likely candidate
runners.spotlight: Bought for £65,000 after finishing third in two Irish points and only just denied on British debut at Kempton two months ago; that form might not be the strongest but it still puts him in the picture for this.

runners.name: Just Orlando
runners.breeder: Mrs H R Cross & Mrs S A Keys
runners.comment: Tailed off in two attempts last November
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two attempts last November.

runners.name: Parsons Stone
runners.comment: Long gap between two starts and well beaten in the second; hood now fitted
runners.spotlight: Hint of promise on debut in July 2021; absent until well beaten at Chepstow in February (66-1, too free); hood fitted.

runners.name: Edeiffs Rock
runners.comment: Kept on to finish third on recent debut; form hard to assess
runners.spotlight: Outsider (40-1) of the field on her debut at Warwick two weeks ago (race restricted to newcomers); looked likely to finish last half a mile out but kept going to take third late on; hard to know what that form is worth but at least it shows she has ability.

runners.name: Madame Bijoux
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Louise Balmer And Partner
runners.comment: Tailed off on her debut last November
runners.spotlight: Beaten more than 50l on her Wincanton debut five months ago.

runners.name: Call To Duty
runners.owner: Mrs N Turner & Mrs E Fenton
runners.comment: Newcomer; dam won over hurdles; trainer can win these races with debutants
runners.spotlight: 30,000euros foal; dam won at 2m2f/3m over hurdles; trainer knows the time of day in bumpers so any support for this debutant should be heeded.

runners.name: Geezer Rockstar
runners.comment: Bumper winners in this newcomer's pedigree and yard does well in these races; one to note
runners.spotlight: Cost 55,000euros last year; dam a hurdle winner and also a sister to two bumper winners; trainer boasts 21% strike-rate in these races so this newcomer needs close monitoring in the betting.

runners.name: Jackpot Dathou
runners.comment: Two narrow bumper defeats, the first in France; almost certainly sets the standard on form
runners.spotlight: Bought for 165,000euros after narrow defeat in a French bumper last October; suffered similar fate on British debut at Kempton last month; form yet to be tested but 17 ran and reasonable to assume he sets the standard on those to have raced.

runners.name: Pescatorius
runners.comment: Newcomer; related to winning pointers; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Bought for 18,000euros last year; related to winning pointers; trainer 0-5 in bumpers so far; others more appealing on paper.

runners.name: Sparkling Duke
runners.comment: Newcomer; plenty of appeal on pedigree; yard also runs Star Of Affinity
runners.spotlight: Plenty of appeal on paper, having cost 80,000euros last year and being a half-brother to five winners, two of them in bumpers; dam won a bumper on her debut so this newcomer ticks plenty of boxes; even if yard, which also runs Star of Affinity, never traditionally strong in these races.
